loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, de 23 años, es una amorosa madre de familia, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Eusebio) de 27 años, y sus 2 hijos: Yeslim de 4 y Luz de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

El puesto de Lucila está ubicado en la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca, ella vende productos andinos (Cañihua, Quinua, etc.), es de las pocas vendedoras que tiene un negocio de este rubro en el mercado, por lo cual tiene muchos clientes y vende casi toda su mercadería, lo cual le da los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que es muy alegre y siempre les saca una sonrisa. Lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta. Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender productos variados, incluyendo sus productos andinos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Lucila con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los seiscientos soles solicitados comprará más productos andinos, los cuales espera vender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Lucila is a loving mother who lives in her own house with her twenty-seven-year-old husband, Eusebio, and her two children : Yeslim, who is four, and Luz, who is two. They are the driving force behind all of her efforts. Her work stall is located in the Sunday street market in the city of Juliaca. She sells Andean products (Cañihua, Quinua, etc.) and is one of the few vendors of this line of products in the market. For this reason, she has many clients and sells almost all of her merchandise, which gives her the income necessary to support her family. What she likes most about her job is having conversations with her clients; she is very happy and always smiling. She's been working for three years in her currrent position and thinks that the most diffficult aspect of the job is to have to stay all day in the same stall. In the future, she hopes to have a store where she can sell various products, including her Andean merchandise. This is Lucila's first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she hopes to be very punctual with her payments. She is very well regarded within her communal bank for the order she brings to the meetings. With the requested funds, she will purchase more Andean products, which she hopes to sell to more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise inventory

loans.name: Marcializa

texts.en:
Marcializa A. is from the village of Looc, Catatarman, Camiguin. She is 32 years old. Marcializa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcializa owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. Marcializa also runs a sari-sari (variety) store.

In 2009, Marcializa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcializa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Marcializa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marcializa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama K. is a married woman who has two sons. Both of her sons are now studying in university. Her husband, Mr. Madan K., is a farmer.  Mrs. K. already owns one cow and she has been selling milk in her area.

In Nepal, pure and fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition.  Rama K. lives in Bhashipati and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing.

She carries her milk containers and sells door to door daily in the morning and in the evening.  Because of the rising demand for milk, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production.  So Mrs. K. is requesting a Rs 30,000.00 loan to purchase a Jersey cow which produces more milk than normal cows.

loans.use: To buy a young cow.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benso sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 5 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Wobougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés.  
Ces femmes ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt  et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé. 
Avec ce  nouveau prêt elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires (frais, en conserve, séchés etc.) au marché de Dioïla  et revendent au village et environnants à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benso are married women averaging 41 years of age and 5 children each.  With their husband and children, the women live in large traditional families and reside in the village of Wobougou, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.  They know one another by ties of community and kinship.  These women joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of making their lucrative businesses sustainable and are now on their second loan.  The preceding one was repaid. With this new loan, the group members intend to buy a large quantity of condiments (fresh, canned, dried, etc.) at the Dioïla market and to resell in town and in the area to customers composed of women and men.  The group members envision realizing a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA per person.  The profits are partly reinvested in the business and partly for covering day-to-day family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying kitchen condiments

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra F. est mariée, elle est âgée de 42 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KA FALL depuis 3 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 7 prêts qu’elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait de l’embouche bovine et ovine. Avec les profits générés par son activité elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Diarra F. is married, 42 years old, and the mother of two children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de KA FALL for 3½ years and has benefited from it in the form of seven loans, which she always managed well and repaid. Diarra fattens cattle and sheep. With the profits generated from her business, she supports her husband in providing for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her business fattening livestock

loans.name: Ronald Ryan

texts.en:
Ronald Ryan D. is from the village of Polo. He is 28 years old. Ronald Ryan is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ronald Ryan owns & operates a food stall where he sells soft drinks and other food products in the local community. Ronald Ryan has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ronald Ryan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronald Ryan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ronald Ryan is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Ronald Ryan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business and to pay for the education of his children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 45 years old and the mother of four children. Her husband is a pastor and he also supports the home.

Catherine sells spiritual items like candles and olive oil and she also sells groceries. With these businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She opens her shop daily from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Her biggest priority is feeding the children and making sure their school fees are paid.

Catherine is asking for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more spiritual items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO micro-finance.

loans.use: To purchase more spiritual items to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is married and has one child. She has received a senior high education.  Comfort cooks beans to sell at Elmina. The cooked bean is usually eaten with an accompaniment such as palm oil, fried ripe plantain and gari, which some people call red-red but is not actually red-red. She has been doing this for sometime now. Her husband is a trader. Comfort uses her income to help her husband pay the utility bills and school fees. Comfort will use the loan to purchase gari, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of the food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase gari, beans and other ingredients

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Juan Ramón R. H., tiene 44 años de edad, casado, es maestro Escuela Primaria de una comunidad Rural que se llama los Zanjones, lugar de donde él también es origunario, tiene dos hijos, una mayor y una menor, la cual está cursando la escuela secundaría.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de tres créditos, los que cuales le han servido para realizar gastos personales y este último para mejorar su vivienda, vale mencionar que en los dos créditos otorgados anteriormente ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This gentleman is Sr. Juan Ramón R. H.. He is 44 years old, married, and works as an elementary school teacher in the rural community where is originally from – Los Zanjones. Juan has two children. One is an adult, while the other is still a minor and currently attends high school.

He has obtained from our Institution three loans which have been used to take care of personal expenses. The most recent one will be used for home improvements. It should be mentioned that Juan met his obligations with his two previous loans and handled them very responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding his field and buying farm supplies

loans.name: Dhedé

texts.fr:
Madame Dhedé Traoré est une femme mariée de 25 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Ayant abandonnée l’école en classe de 9ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien), elle s’intéressa très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des pagnes,  des chaussures, des draps de lit, etc depuis maintenant 6 ans. Elle est très sollicitée et appréciée à Bougouni et jouit d’une grande clientèle.
Dans le souci de satisfaire  cette  clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et exigeante, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, elle est à son 6ème prêt individuel après avoir correctement remboursés tous les cinq prêts précédents.
Elle compte utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, des pièces de  pagnes et des paires chaussures  à Lomé et au Burkina Faso. Elle effectue sa vente à la maison et au grand marché de Bougouni, en détail, au comptant et à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  avec ce prêt, un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000 FCFA qui servira à agrandir son entreprise et d’appui à son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dhedé Traoré is a married woman, 25 years of age and the mother of two children. She lives wit her husband and children in the North Hérémakono district of the town of Bougoni, in the third administrative region of Mali. Having dropped out of school while in the 9th grade (in the national secondary education system), she very early got engaged in commercial activities, particularly purchasing and reselling “pagnes” (traditional fabric for wrap clothing), shoes, bed linens and so on, which she has been doing for six years now. Her business is very popular and well known in Bougoni, and she has a large number of customers. In order to satisfy the needs of this growing and ever more demanding customer base, she has decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and is now seeking her sixth individual loan after having properly reimbursed each of the preceding five loans. She plans to use this new loan to purchase “pagnes” and shoes in Lomé and in Burkina Faso. She sells from her home as well at the big market in Bougoni, retail, for cash or on credit. With this loan she plans to achieve a monthly income of 75,000 West African Francs, which will allow her to grow her business and help her husband provide for the family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various articles (for resale)

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy C., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She produces baskets for sale for an income of about USD 2.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  C. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase more plastics to produce plastic baskets for new and existing customers. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy plastic to produce plastic baskets

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 49 years old and married with three children.  He has been selling scrap metals and grass hay to earn a living.  He has been doing this work for the past ten years.  Daniel is able to sell hay because he is surrounded by many livestock farmers. He likes his work very much because it is aimed at keeping the environment clean and safe by recycling waste materials such as scrap metals.  He is also involved in dairy farming. 

He joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that he can access financial support.  He has been an active member of the group and has been consistent in paying back the loans he gets from Faulu Kenya.  For this reason, he has been guaranteed by his group members another loan of 90,000 KES.  He plans to buy more hay and scrap metals to sell.

Daniel appreciates that he has been able to educate his children and that he has been able to add more dairy cows on his farm through Faulu Kenya.

loans.use: To buy hay and scrap metals to resell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: This lady is 37 years old. She works at a business selling beauty products. Her husband works doing painting and touch-ups of automobiles. They have three children. She sells her products by loading them onto her head and distributing them throughout the streets. She's worked at this business since 2002. Now she has requested her first loan from WAGES of 200,000 CFA in order to purchase various products such as cosmetics, nail polish, and fake nails.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Isaaf

texts.en:
Isaaf is a 47-year-old single woman from Lebanon. Isaaf has been working as a hairdresser. She has over ten years of experience in her domain.

Isaaf also sells wedding dresses. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 1500 USD in order to purchase new wedding dresses. This is her second loan, and she repaid her previous loan on time. Her previous loan allowed her to improve her business and to help with her family expenses. Isaaf decided to have her business, because she has experience and knows how to treat her clients. In the future, she plans to continue improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase new wedding dresses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty salon products

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily V. is from the village of San Roque, Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Emily is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products and buying and selling wood charcoal in the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emily is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Emily from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Gorgorlou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité GORGORLOU est créé au 7è cycle du Banc Villageois de GADAPARA en 2006. Il est composé de 07 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par solidarité et voisinage.

Madame Aminata D. debout à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Elle vend des jus de fruits naturels qu’elle fabrique de ses propres mains. La vente se fait à domicile et au marché central de son quartier.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des fruits et condiments pour la fabrique de ses jus

Elle a comme objectif de payer la scolarité de ses enfants, de participer à la nourriture de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
Solidarity group GORGORLOU was created in 2006, during the seventh cycle of the "Banc Villageois de GADAPARA". It is composed of seven women from the same neighborhood. They created their group out of solidarity and because they are neighbors. Mrs. Aminata D., standing on the right in the picture, is the head of the group. She's 46 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She sells natural fruit juices that she makes herself. She sells at her home, as well as at the central market in her neighborhood. She will use her new loan to buy fruits and ingredients needed to make her juices. Her goal is to pay her children's school expenses and help feed her family, while at the same time bolstering her savings.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and ingredients to make fruit juices

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana, D. 43 años, es una madre D. familia muy emprendedora, vive en su casa propia, junto a sus 2 hijos. Hace más D. 20 años, se dedica a realizar cortes, tintes, rayitos, ondulaciones  y maquillajes en general. Inicialmente trabajaba en un puesto dentro del mercado que queda a 4 cuadras D. su domicilio. Con el tiempo y a base D. mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo construir su casa, por lo que acondiciono un espacio para sauna (baños D. vapor), emprendiendo un nuevo negocio. Se siente muy satisfecha por los logros que tiene, y que hoy en día tiene un spa, atendiendo a sus clientes con mucha delicadeza y atención. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar el servicio con masajes focalizados a petición D. sus clientes. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas como hasta hoy, ya que sabe que este dinero le será D. mucha utilidad. Roxana tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra D. líquidos, tintes y lociones para el cuidado y tratamiento D. piel, D. ese modo continuar brindando un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Roxana is 43 years old and an enterprising mother. She lives in her own home with her two children. For more than 20 years, Roxana has been providing haircuts, coloring, highlights, perms, and general makeovers. She started working from a vending space at the market, which is four blocks from her house. After a lot of hard work and sacrifice over a period of time, she was able to build a house. Roxana wants to remodel one of the rooms to install a sauna (steam bath) so that she can launch a new business. She is very pleased with what she has achieved. Now she has a spa where she provides her customers great care and attention. In the future she plans to expand her services by providing massage therapy at the request of her customers.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. She promises to complete her payments in the same manner that she does today because the money will be very useful. Roxana plans to invest this loan in the purchase of fluids, tints, and lotions used in administering skin care treatments so that she can continue providing good service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products used for skin treatments

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: La Sra. María Elena M. García ella es Trabajadora del Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como Camarera tiene  seis años de trabajar para esta empresa. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel  le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María Elena M. García Works at Hotel Barceló Montelimar as a waitress. She has been working for this business for six years. She has had six loans with CEPRODEL and she has used each one for the purchase of construction materials and to improve the house where she lives. The loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her in a great way since as a result, she has improved her living condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, stone, and gravel

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia M. is married and lives in Prk. Lerio, Brgy Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, where she makes a living buying and selling dried fish.  Her husband, Anthony M., is 41 years old, works as a driver and also helps in his wife in her business as time permits. They have three children who range in age from 12 to 17 years old. Virgilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wanted a better life for her family. With the help of 10 previous loans, she has been lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. She now earns a monthly profit of PHP 15,000 and has applied for a new loan, for PHP 28,000, to expand her business and continue to improve her family's living conditions.

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to expand her small business selling dried fish

loans.name: Mayra Amparo

texts.es:
MAYRA AMPARO G. G.,Trabaja como Intructor de Belleza en el centro capacitación alemán nicaragüense  CECNA, ha trabajado dos prestamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa de habitacion, ella tiene dos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
el prestamo utilizado es para la compra de  materiales de construcción  de su casa va cambiar el Sistema Electrico de su casa, y el resto en gastos familiares  que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Mayra Amparo G. G. is a Beauty instructor working for the National Technological Institute named CECNA (Centro de Capacitación  Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán). She has been granted two loans by Ceprodel, which have been used to improve her house. She has two children who are still in school.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy building materials for her house: she will change the electrical wiring of her house. She will use part of the loans to settle a few unpaid family expenses as well.

loans.use: To change the electrical wiring of her house and to settle family expenses.

loans.name: Khai's Group

texts.en:
Khai T. N. is 52 years old and has 2 children. She is a farmer and focuses on growing rice and corn, and raising 150 chickens and 9 pigs.  Agricultural products are partly used to support her family's food needs and partly for sale to generate income. She has been doing this work for many years. Since becoming a client in 2004, she has used loans effectively to expand her farming works. Currently, she wants a loan of 6,322,000VND to buy food for poultry.

Mui T. N. is 55 years old. She is living with her family in Kimtien village. She is managing one boat that transports soil for construction. This kind of business has a high profit. Currently, she wants a loan of 2,398,000 VND to improve her boat.

Hop T. N.  is 42 years old and has 3 children who are at high school. She is raising 5 pigs and one cow. She needs a loan of 4,142,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy food for poultry

loans.name: Amelia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Amelia del Socorro M. M.,  es comerciante del mercado central de Chinandega su negocio es venta de productos varios lo que le llaman  montón es casada madre de dos niños por los que lucha y sale adelante uno de sus niños esta en edad escolar el otro no porque esta pequeñito, sus financiamientos los ha invertido en su negocio su negocio ha crecido bastante su inventario ha crecido tiene cinco años de trabajar con Ceprodel y se siente bien agradecida con estos financiamientos ya que los ha invertido muy bien y su calidad de vida ha mejora do bastante.
texts.en: Amelia works as a merchant in the central market of Chinandega selling various products. She is a married mother of two children, whom she works hard for to make headway. One of is school age while the other one is still little. Amelia has used her financing to invest in her business. Her business has grown a lot and so has her inventory. She has worked with Kiva partner Ceprodel for the past five years and feels grateful for the the loans since they have helped her make good investments and her quality of life has improved quite a bit.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, toys, etc.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with a teenage son Alexei. She is an entrepreneur from the agricultural region of Kamenka. In this part of Ukraine, most people earn their living by farming and Larisa is no exception. She owns two land lots on which she constructed 2 arch greenhouses and a third one for seedlings. Larisa decided to try her luck in the farming business 17 years ago. Ever since, she has invested 45,000 UAH in it and she spends about 18,000 UAH yearly on seeds and polyethylene film. 

Larisa is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase seeds and polyethylene film for her greenhouses. She is planning to reinvest the income she generates into further expansion of her business and into building more greenhouses on her property in the future. Larisa believes this sphere of agriculture has good potential for growth. She is willing to invest in her business to make it a successful enterprise, bringing her stable income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and polyethylene film

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 27 years old and single.  Theogene owns an Internet café in Kimironko, a suburb of Kigali. He provides internet access for his customers and has a secretarial service for his customers.  

Theogene has requested this loan to buy more paper, ink for printers, files, and more internet broadband.  His dream is to buy more computers for his growing business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over ten years, she has operated a doughnut selling business from home. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of competition from other doughnuts sellers in the market. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, yeast and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, yeast and sugar.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the eastern part of the country.  Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture.  Simon's community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity.

Simon requires a loan to buy diverse inventory (such as cinnamon, and other similar products) for wholesale in order to sell them to others.  He has been running this business for five years.  Simon has taken out a number of loans with field partner Esperanza International over the past five years, all of which have been paid back in full.  He has used these loans to diversify the products that he sells.  He is very excited about taking out this loan so that he can continue to grow his business.

Simon says that his favorite thing is to be with his family, and he hopes that the profits from his business will be saved to buy a bus.  His dream is to have his own house and this vehicle.

loans.use: To buy cinnamon and other similar products for sale.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena J. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Rowena is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & supplies

loans.name: Martha Francina

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Masaya, del Departamento de Masaya, la señora Martha Francina R. O. se dedica a la labor de Cajera en ENACAL desde hace tres años. Es madre soltera y con dos hijos menores de edad a quienes les trata de cubrir todas sus necesidades.

Una de las necesidades en la que se enfrenta la señora R. O. es la de mejorar su vivienda, debido a esto ha decidido el solicitar un crédito en las Oficinas de CEPRODEL el cual tiene como fin el comprar distintos materiales de construcción para llegar a satisfacer su necesidad y de esta forma poder darle un techo digno y con mayor seguridad a sus hijos.

La señora siente que con este cambio en su hogar le estaría protegiendo la salud de sus hijos ya que prefiere hacer estos cambios antes que entre la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
For three years, Martha Francina R. O. has been working as a cashier at ENACAL (Nicaraguan water supply and sewerage company), in the town of Masaya, in Masaya department.  She is a single mother who has two dependent children.  She tries to meet all their needs.

One of the needs that Mrs R. O. has is that of improving her home.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from CEPRODEL's offices so that she can purchase the building supplies that she needs to meet her needs.  In this way, she will be able to provide her children with a decent home and better safety.

Mrs R. O. feels that this work on her home will protect her children's health.  She would prefer to carry out the work before the winter comes.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Veronica Beatriz

texts.es:
Verónica, de 23 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, es madre soltera tiene un hijo de un año de edad, vive con su madre y sus hermanos, Ella se dedica a vender en una tienda donde ofrece productos del hogar, este negocio le ayuda a mantenerse y a darle a su hija lo necesario, también a su madre con los gastos de la casa.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería y aumentar el inventario, los productos que necesita son: pastas, embutidos, arroz, frijol, aceite, detergentes y cosméticos. Con esta inversión espera satisfacer las necesidades y peticiones de los clientes, así mismo mejorar su condición de comerciante.
Las aspiraciones de Verónica en relación al negocio, es surtirlo de los productos más necesarios y demandados, que sus ventas aumenten, ser cada día más competente y en su familia pues garantizarles una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Veronica, 23 years old, lives in the Jiquilisco department of Usulutan.  She is a single mother of a one-year-old son, and she lives with her mother and her siblings.  She works selling household items in a small store, and this business helps her support herself and give her son what he needs; it also helps her mother with household expenses.  

She is currently applying for this loam to buy merchandise and increase her inventory.  The products she needs are: pasta, sausages, rice, beans, oil, detergent, and cosmetics.  With this investment, she hopes to satisfy the needs and requests of her clients, and at the same time improve her business. Veronica's goals in relation to the business are to supply people with the most necessary and in-demand products so that her sales increase; she hopes to gain new skills every day, and to be able to guarantee her family a better and more secure financial future.

loans.use: Purchase of pasta, sausage, rice, beans, oil, detergent, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Buikwe Group B-Lugazi

texts.en:
Rogers K. is a happily married 34-year-old gentleman.  He has 5 children who are all in school. Rogers operates a general merchandise retail shop in Lugazi town. This shop has been in existence for the past decade.  He started it using some of the savings from his farming business. 

Weekly this business generates for him 150,000 shillings.  He says with this loan, he is going to purchase more general merchandise stock to resell. Rogers also operates a rental business.  He is affiliated with the Zibula Atudde Buikwe group B-Lugazi.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to resell

loans.name: Primas De Betania Group

texts.es: Este  grupo se llama “Las Primas de Betania” esta ubicado en Quintana Roo, México. La señora Francisca P. C. es integrante del grupo. Ella se dedica al bordado o la elaboración de hipiles que es un traje típico de la región maya de Quintana Roo ella pide este préstamo para invertir en la compra de hilos y telas, el cual lo utiliza para hacer crecer su negocio. Se siente orgullosa y contenta porque gracias a este préstamo logrará mejorar su negocio y podrá hacer una gran variedad de trajes como ternos, aumentando sus ventas  y así mismo sus ganancias. Además de conservar la belleza de su cultura. Esta experiencia le permite crear una cultura de ahorro y se propuso en la vida lograr la superación y mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia. Doña Francisca es una persona muy trabajadora, que tiene 7 hijos los cueles  la mayoría ya están casados, ya que con esfuerzo y trabajo los ha podido sacar adelante y seguirá trabajando como hasta ahora para mejorar su negocio y dar bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: This group is called “Las Primas de Betania” and is located in Quintana Roo, Mexico.  Francisca P. C. is a member of this group.  Francisca embroiders and makes 'huipiles' which are traditional tunics or blouses from the Maya region of Quintana Roo.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying threads and fabrics which she will use to grow her business.  She feels proud and happy because, thanks to this loan, she will manage to improve her business and make a large variety of outfits such as suits, increasing her sales and thereby her profits.  She will also be able to conserve the beauty of her culture.  This experience allows her to create a culture of saving and she plans to better herself and improve her family's quality of life.  Francisca is a very hard-working person who has 7 children, most of whom are already married.  Through effort and hard work, she has managed to get her children ahead in life and she will continue to work, as she has done up until now, in order to improve her business and provide for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to invest in buying threads and fabric

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa works hard to support her family. Jesusa is married and has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines.

Jesusa requested a PHP 16,500 loan through NWTF to purchase a bike and a sidecar.

Jesusa has been in this business for six years now and also earns additional income from a ready to wear (RTW) business.

In the future, Jesusa would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase a bike and sidecar

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur  Cheikh D. habite à  Yoff. Il est marié et âgé  de 38 ans. Il a en charge une famille avec  2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 6 ans. Monsieur D. était auparavant un cultivateur. Il a renoncé à cette activité a cause du manque d’espace auquel il était confronté et aussi de  la non rentabilité de son exploitation. Ainsi il s’est orienté vers  le commerce sous l’influence d’un ami agriculteur qui a été le premier à l’approvisionner en oignons lors du démarrage de son activité. Actuellement  son activité concerne l’achat d’oignons au village et d’huile qu’il revend  aux restaurateurs et boutiquiers de la localité de Yoff. Il est sociétaire du guichet de Yoff depuis janvier 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour acheter de l’huile et des oignons pour les besoins de son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr Sheik D. lives in Yoff. 

He is married and 38 years old.

He has a family with 2 children aged  2 and 6 years.
 
Mr D. was a farmer.

He gave up this activity because of the lack of arable land with which he was confronted and also nonprofitability of its operation.

Thus he was directed towards this business by a friend farmer who was the first to supply him onions during his business startup. 

Currently his activity is the purchase of onions at the village and oil which he resells to the restaurants and convenience stores of the locality of Yoff. 

He is member of the credit union of Yoff since January 2011. 

He requests a credit of 300.000 frs destined to buy oil and onions for the needs of his business.

loans.use: achat oignon et huile

loans.name: Nikki

texts.en:
Nikki T., from the village of Sebac,Tudela, Misamis Occidental, is 42 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nikki owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily-use products such as sugar, canned goods, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nikki joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, she is requesting her third loan loan for 7000 PHP to purchase dried fish and bagoong for sale. Nikki plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and bagoong for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras!!! Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  Mujeres Triunfadoras , porque la mayoria de las integrantes trabajan en un pequeño taller de costura donde maquilan mercancia de otras empresas estan ubicadas en el estado de Mexico. El grupo se encuentra conformado por 9 integrantes y es la cuarta vez que solicita un prestamo. La señora Elizabeth S. R. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene treinta años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, se dedica a la maquila de ropa para otras marcas y tiene un hijo. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en materia prima y poder solventar las necesidades de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo adquirir un mayor prestigio y poder expander su negocio. Al solicitar este prestamo se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad que le brindan de continuar invirtiendo e incrementar sus ventas y en consecuente poder expander y hacer crescer su micro empresa. Tambien espera con las ganancias que obtenga apoyar a su familia en los gastos y darle educación a su hijo para que consiga lograr sus sueños.
texts.en: The name of this group is Mujeres Triunfadoras (Victorious Women) as the majority of its members work in a small sewing shop where they manufacture products for different Mexican companies. The group is composed of 9 members, and this is the fourth time they are requesting a loan. Mrs. Elizabeth S. R. is the president of the group. She is 30 years old, she studied through high school, she has one child and she engages in manufacturing clothes for different brands. The loan she is requesting will be used to invest in purchasing raw materials to satisfy her customers’ requests and, at the same time, to become more prestigious thus succeeding in expanding her activity. In requesting this loan she feels very happy about the opportunity she is offered to continue investing and increasing her sales, as this will consequently allow her small business to grow. She also hopes that the money she will earn will allow her to help contributing to her family’s expenses, as well as paying for an education for her son so that will help him achieving his dreams.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of raw materials to manufacture clothes.

loans.name: Josefa Cupertina

texts.es: Josefa Cupertina D. cincuenta y seis años D. edad vive en casa propia junto a su compañero D. vida. Ella posee un negocio D. venta D. comida y tortillas en el lugar donD. resiD.. Josefa como toda mujer emprendedora trabaja todos los días haciendo lo que más le gusta, que es cocinar. Ella tiene un sazón inigualable al preparar las comidas y es así como satisface el paladar D. las personas que la visitan, además también es un lugar muy higiénico y con precios accesibles. Últimamente se ha hecho D. mas clientela y quiere estar preparada para no decepcionarlos es por eso que Josefa le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz para sus tortillas y material para las comidas como embutidos, carnes, granos básicos, bebidas entre otros. Josefa tiene la esperanza D. que si su negocio prospera le podrá dar a su familia la vida plena que se merecen.
texts.en: Josefa Cupertina is 56 years old, and she lives in her own house with her partner.  She has a business selling food and tortillas in her home. Josefa, like all businesswomen, works every day doing what she likes most: cooking. She has an unequaled flavoring that she uses to prepare her food, and this satisfies the palates of her customers. Also, her business is very clean, and her food is reasonably priced. Ultimately, she wants to grow her clientele and ensure that she doesn’t disappoint her customers. Because of this, Josefa is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will permit her to buy corn for her tortillas and ingredients for her food, including cured meat, meat, basic grains, and drinks, among other items. Josefa hopes that her business will prosper so that she will be able to give her family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn to prepare tortillas and ingredients for cured meat, meat, basic grains, and drinks

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: Ren earns about US$3 per day working in the port. She is a fish domestic laborer in the province of Siem Reap. She has a life partner, her husband, who works as a porter and earns an average of US$4 each day to help support Ren with the family expenses. They are blessed with eight children, five are single, the remaining three are married and live in separate houses. Two of their children are employed as a ferry boat deliverer and a porter. Recently, the family met a problem as the walls of their house were broken down in most parts. So Ren has sought a loan to purchase some wooden poles to rebuild her broken walls.

loans.use: to purchase wooden poles to rebuild her broken walls.

loans.name: Rojasse

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome ao sul de Moçambique é casado e pai de 3 filhos, de idades entre 2 anos a 12 anos. Fez 4a classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.   
saiu de Maputo para Massaca em Boane quando obteve o seu terreno, onde fixou sua residencia. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 2 anos onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt  por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez do cunhado que tambem é cliente desta instituiçao e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (arroz, amendoim, açucar e outros) para aumentar a quantidade  no seu estabelecimento.
o seu sonho e concluir a sua obra e ampliar o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Born in Maputo city,  in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique, he is married with three children, ages 2 years to 12 years. He stopped his own schooling in the 4th grade due to lack of money.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his mother by sending money to help her pay for food.

He left Maputo for Massaca in Boane when he obtained his land, where his build his home.  He has a business selling staple household products for over 2 years now that provides earnings of about 4.000.00mt a month which he applies to household expenses and can still manage to save some in his personal bank account.

He has never borrowed from other banks.  He heard of the Hluvuku agency through his brother who also is a loan recipient of this institution.  This is his first loan in the amount of 10.000.00mt with which he will buy goods (rice, peanuts, sugar and others) to increase the amount of inventory in his business.  

His dream and to finish his home construction and expand his business for which he intends to seek further loans from the Hluvuku agency.

loans.use: comprar  e venda de mercadoria (arroz, amendoim, açucar e outros)

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 21-year-old single man. To earn a living, he runs a salon and a cosmetics shop. Besides that, he also does carpentry for more income generation. He has managed to grow his business through Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

Alex dreams of owning rental houses in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chairs for the salon and a shaving machine.

loans.use: To buy chairs for the salon and a shaving machine.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a married woman with seven children, three still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food for the family. For the past four years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells fresh water which contributes to her income. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. With the Kshs 30,000 Mwanajuma wants to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Mrs. Kol works in a factory in Phnom Penh, making $4 per day.  Her husband is a fisherman in the lakes and rivers near their home.  He earns $3 per day.  They would like a loan of $1000 to repair their old house.

loans.use: to repair her old house

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila forma parte del Banco comunal “Ayelen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. Ella se dedica a vender lencería, perfumes y cosméticos desde hace 10 años. Su dinámica es ofrecer sus productos por catalogo, a veces sus clientes la llaman para solicitar sus productos y posteriormente Zoila los entrega a domicilio. Su horario es flexible y su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Temuco.
El crédito lo ahorrará, ya que una de sus metas es incursionar en el rubro de amasandería e instalar una panadería. Para esto ya ha cotizado la maquinaria necesaria para el negocio como un horno industrial de cuatro bandejas, una revolvedora y una amasadora. Además se asociará con un familiar. 
Zoila vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 28 y 13 años de edad, su hijo mayor ya es un profesional y trabaja como ingeniero comercial. 
Sus sueños son seguir invirtiendo en su proyecto en la instalación de la panadería.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con los créditos y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le han permitido invertir lo que ha sido un gran apoyo para ella. Comenta que las capacitaciones le han servido para registrar sus gastos e ingresos y de ésta manera organizar su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal éste tiene muy buena comunicación.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Zoila belongs to the “Ayelen” Communal Bank in the city of Temuco. She has sold lenins, perfumes, and cosmetics for 10 years now. She sells her products from a catalog. At times, customers call her to solicit products and later, Zoila delivers to their homes. Her schedule is flexible and she obtains her merchandise in the city of Temuco itself.

Zoila will save the funds she is borrowing to apply to one of her goals, which is to enter the bakery business, installing her own bakery. For this, she has priced the necessary machinery, including an industrial oven with 4 trays, and a mixer, and a kneading machine. She will partner with a family member. Zoila lives with her husband and their 2 children, aged 28 and 13. her older boy is already a professional and works with a commercial engineer.

Her dream is to continue investing in the installation of her projected  bakery.

Zoila is very content and grateful for the loans and services offered through Fondo Esperanza, which has already allowed her to invest. It has been a great help to her. She comments that the training sessions have taught her how to track costs and earnings and in this way, to organize her business. With respect to the communal bank group's members, they have very good communication.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). In its surrounding areas there are a series of hot springs and lakes (Pucon, Villarrica), and very attractive native flora and fauna, concentrated in the nearby natural parks that exist in our country.

loans.use: to save the money towards installing a bakery.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is 35 years old and lives in P-5 San Antonio, Ozamis City. She is married and has 3 children. 

Naneth is a caretaker. She has had this work for 4 years. She requested a loan for 14,900 to purchase materials for her house renovation.
Naneth has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Naneth hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase lumber for her house repairs.

location.town: Ozamis-San Antonio, Ozamis City, Mis. Occidental

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun is a silk weaver and her husband, Neang, is a fisherman. They have been married since 1980 and have six children: five sons and one daughter. The daughter is a garment worker, one son is married and lives outside the family home, two attend school and the other two stay at home. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Thoeun is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase fishing nets for her husband and to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

Photo: Thoeun and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and weaving materials

loans.name: Jesel

texts.en:
Jesel, age 30, is a gasoline retailer in her village. She sells her wares from her home and earns PhP 9,000 a month. She and her husband have one child, and they help each other in their goal of providing a comfortable life for their small family. 

Jesel is asking a for a loan amount of PhP 6,000 buy additional gasoline to sell. She wants to grow her gasoline business so that she can eventually afford to acquire and open her desired business in the near future: a general store business.

Jewel married very young, while still studying in high school. She began her schooling in college, but when she became pregnant she was forced to leave her studies. This caused her not to finish her tertiary education.

loans.use: to buy additional gasoline to offer for sale

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús labora para una empresa azucarera de una zona de San Rafael desempeñándose como obrero agrícola, es padre de un hijo, casado y con muchos deseos de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su amada familia. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que requiere mejorar su vivienda y para ello espera ser beneficiado con el crédito que sin duda lo aprovechará al máximo y así saldrá adelante en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en: Manuel de Jesús works as a farm worker for a sugar-producing company in an area of San Rafael. He is the father of one child, married and very anxious to improve the living conditions of his beloved family. He is seeking the loan for the purchase of construction materials since he must make improvements to his living quarters. He hopes to receive the benefit of the loan since he will doubtless utilize it fully and thus come out ahead in his economic development.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for the repair of his living quarters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr: Monsieur El hadji est un homme de 38 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et père d’un enfant de 2 ans. Il est  commerçant  et s’active dans la vente de chapelets  depuis  plus de 10 ans. Il a fréquenté l’école coranique depuis son enfance et par la suite il s’est orienté dans ce volet par  passion, mais  aussi sur la recommandation de ses parents. Il est surtout intéressé par l’aspect lucratif de son activité. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2010. Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de chapelet en vue de renforcer son  stock et aussi de le diversifier. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. El Hadji is a 38-year old man who lives in Senegal. He is married and father of one 2-year old child.  He is a merchant and has been active in the sale of rosaries for more than 10 years.  He has attended an Islamic school since childhood and subsequently decided on his direction because of passion but also at the recommendation of his parents. He is especially interested in the lucrative nature of his business. He has been a member of a branch of UIMCEC since February 2010. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs to purchase rosaries to strengthen his inventory and also to diversify it.  The increase in his profits will allow him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase rosaries for resale.

loans.name: Sideth

texts.en:
Sideth (in the photo), 29, is single, lives with his widow mother in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sideth sells flower and small trees at home. He wants to expand his business. Hence he is asking for a loan of $700 to buy more flowers and small trees for sale.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more flowers and small trees for sale.

loans.name: Pheoun

texts.en: Pheoun is 39, married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Pheoun and her husband buy rice in stock to resell. This couple works very hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. Pheoun is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to travel to buy rice. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to travel to buy rice for sale

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children.

Alfredo provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

Alfredo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alfredo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy tools, and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат женщина в возрасте 33 лет, мать двоих детей. Она кредитуется с 2009 года. Её муж работает водителем маршрутного такси, его доход еле хватает на жизнь семьи, поэтому он решил помочь жене в 2002 год открыть свою торговую точку в центре города при входе больницы. У неё постоянно идет торговля, так как посещающие больных покупают у неё нужные товары. У Мухаббат очень разнообразный ассортимент продуктов питания и питьевых напитков и она старается постоянно его пополнять. Она помогает в семейных расходах мужу с полученной прибыли.На полученный кредит она хочет увеличить свой товарооборот под праздники Нового года.
texts.en: Muhabbat is a 33 year-old woman, who is a mother of two children.  She has been obtaining financing since 2009.  Her husband works as a shuttle taxi driver, and his income is barely enough for the family's living expenses.  This is why he decided to help his wife to open her own retail outlet by the hospital entrance in the city center in 2002.  Muhabbat's business is always active because patients coming to the hospital purchase necessary products from her.  She carries a variety of food products and beverages and always tries to add more selections to the assortment.  Muhabbat helps her husband with the family expenses with her obtained profits.  She wants to use this loan to increase her product turnover prior to the New Year's holidays.

loans.use: to increase her product turnover prior to the holidays

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is 53 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money by operating a cafe in front of their house.

Quyen is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase coffee and a greater range and quantity of soft drinks to stock her cafe. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. Quyen also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and a greater range and quantity of soft drinks to stock her cafe.

loans.name: Clarisse Yabo

texts.fr: Clarisse Yabo est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un comptable du nom de Gaïtan. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clarisse Yabo et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Clarisse Yabo a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis environs huit ans, Clarisse Yabo mène comme activité la vente de vêtements et des vivres de façon secondaire dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les charges familiales. Clarisse Yabo achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Clarisse Yabo sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Clarisse Yabo is 29 and is married to an accountant named Gaïtan. They care for their 3 children, who all go to school. Clarisse Yabo and her husband both take care of the family financially. Clarisse Yabo quit school at the secondary level. For 8 years, she has been selling clothes and food, on the side, in her neighborhood, which has enabled her to provide for herself and her family. Clarisse Yabo buys these items in Benin. In order to increase the stock of these items and better meet the needs of her customers, Clarisse Yabo is applying for a fourth loan from ALIDÉ. Previous loans have been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy clothes and food.

loans.name: Muna

texts.es: Muna is a 49 year old married woman who supports 3 family members from Sahab Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to pay for her home improvements, she wants to buy a new furniture and repaint her home. In the future she would like to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Phu

texts.en: Mrs. Phu is a hardworking woman, 46 years old. She has two children, all of them have a job. She sells fish and has been in this business for 20 years. She has also daily income from garden such as chicken, duck and vegetable. With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Zaila

texts.en: Zaila lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam.She is married and has two sons.Zaila is in a food vending business.She has four years in this business.She wants to improve her business by adding dining tables and chairs,food serving dishes and stock of cold drinks.On usual working hours her busines is normally flocked with customers in need of services.Sometimes she looses some customers due to inadequate equipments.She also in need of a cupboard for keeping food serving dishes hygienically.To facilitate her plan Zaila needs USD 400.

loans.use: BUSINESS IMPROVEMENT

loans.name: Owola

texts.en:
Dr. Owola is an obstetrics/gynecology practitioner managing his own private facility in Bungoma, Western Province, Kenya. He is 50 years old and lives with his wife and eight children. His wife is employed as a nurse in a government facility. After his training he was employed by the government and posted to Nyanza provincial Hospital in Kisumu, where he worked for three years. He then resigned from government and started his own private facility.

He has applied for a loan of Us $1,200 to renovate his facility, purchase additional furniture, increase the number of beds primarily for admissions, and to purchase a stock of drugs in bulk.

loans.use: To renovate his facility

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and diversify his cyber cafe business

loans.name: Aura

texts.es:
Business Description

Aura has an experience of 15 years as a merchant. She started selling food 10 years ago. Thanks to the help of her husband she gathered the capital and started selling lunches and snacks. She has done well due to the good taste of her meals. She works everyday from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. and in the weekends until 12 p.m. She is also investing in the purchase of yogurt per liter. Moreover she sells clothes to her friends being this another source of income.

Loan Use

The loan will be use to buy kitchen tools. She will also buy merchandise since she has a business unit at the city’s market. She has a good demand and she hopes to please all of her clients.

Personal information

Aura is married. She is 46 years old and has 5 children. Two of them are in school. In their free time they help her mother to serve the clients and also with the purchases. His husband works as a bus driver. Thanks to both their work, they have managed to finish little by little their small house. Her wish is to give a better home environment to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Aura tiene una experiencia de 15 años con el comercio. Hace 10 se inicio sola con la venta de comida. Gracias a la ayuda de su esposo reúne capital y comienza con su venta de almuerzos y meriendas. Le ha ido muy bien que la buscan debido a su buena sazón en las comidas. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. y los fines de semana hasta las 12 p.m. También esta invirtiendo en la compra de yogurt por litro. Además también vende ropa a sus amistades convirtiéndose este en otro ingreso para el hogar.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de utensilios de cocina. Y también en la compra de mercadería ya que ella tiene un puesto en un mercado de la ciudad. Tiene una buena demanda y espera poder complacer a todos sus clientes.

Información Personal

Aura esta casada. Tiene 46 años y 5 hijos. Dos de ellos estudian. En sus momentos libres le ayudan a su mama en la atención del local y también con las compras. Su esposo trabaja de chofer en un colectivo de la ciudad. Gracias a su trabajo y el de su esposo ha logrado poco a poco ir terminando su casita. Su deseo es darle un mejor ambiente a su familia.

loans.use: Buy kitchen tools and merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria sells vegetables and travels rural areas within the Department (state/province) of La paz to sell her products. Her husband is employed in a fabric factory and hence they make their main income with which they provide for her two year old daughter.

She lives in the Villa Ingenio area in the El Alto City, in the street of Tiwuanacu .

She will use the credit she is requesting to purchase merchandise, since there is a high demand for vegetables in the areas that make her market. In that way, Maria hopes to increase her family's income.

It is her first credit with Impro; her wishes to move on and the evaluation realized allow her access to the loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Maria es comerciante de hortalizas y viaja a las zonas rurales del Departamento de La Paz para vender su producto. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una fabrica de tejidos y así reúnen los ingresos principales con los que mantienen una hija de 2 años. Vive en la zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto, en la calle Tiwuanacu. El crédito que solicita lo destinara para comprar mercadería, pues existe mucha demanda de hortalizas en las zonas que forman su mercado. De esa forma Maria piensa incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Es el primer crédito con Impro, pero sus deseos de superación y la evaluación realizada le permiten acceder al préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ishowori

texts.en: Mrs. Ishowori S., 50, lives in Kulashwor, Kathmandu, with her husband and a son. Her husband, Mr. Shyam Bahadur S., is a retired officer, and her son also has no work, so the condition of their family is very miserable. They can't even fulfill their basic needs. To overcome their problem they opened their grocery shop 2-3 months ago. All three members of her family equally contribute in that shop. They work hard to earn more. Because of the hard work, their family condition is improving. Now Mrs. S. is asking for a loan to buy grocery goods to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Djamal

texts.en: Djamal (his brother is pictured) is single and lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. He is 23 years old. This young man has run this business for 8 years. Djamal requests a loan of $1200 to buy clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is fifty years old and she and her husband have five grown children that attend university.  For more than three years, María has been selling an assortment of perfumes, deodorants and women’s clothing.  Her and her husband are working hard to support the children’s studies since they are unemployed.
Every two weeks, María goes to purchase goods at the Fleet Market, where goods can be obtained at very low prices.  She explains with enthusiasm that she makes a monthly profit of about US $100.
Currently, the businesswoman is talking about expanding her business and attracting more customers.  She has requested a loan to purchase additional goods and new ones such as body lotion and hair care products.

loans.use: The loan will be invested in clothing and care products for a small store.

loans.name: Total B(2088)B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Suzan B.. She is currently runs a pub/bar and is requesting a loan to purchase more beer. Suzan is 28 years old and is married. She has 2 children aged 10 and 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Suzan makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more brew for sale.

Suzan is joined in her small group by Racheal SS., Maureen Z., Robinah N., and Grace Nankya. Racheal SS. is currently runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Maureen Z. is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to purchase more birds. Robinah N. is currently in the business of used clothing and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Grace Nankya is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase various brands of beers and wines

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina is a 33-year-old woman from Hlapčevići, a small village near Visoko. She is  married  and her husband has a full-time job. His monthly salary is about US$ 500. They have 2 children, one month and  7 years old. Edina does farming and she will use this loan in the amount of  US$ 1,150 for buying  material for planting. With selling the crops she raises, Edina thinks that she will ensure additional income for her  family.

loans.use: Buying material for planting

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, who belongs to the community bank, Señor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian, sells candy and groceries, in the Chiquian district, Bolognesi province, in the area of Ancash.

With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 les ($375), Ana will be able to pay for 6 dues, two sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, a box of oil, one sack of salt, two packets of detergent, a box of apples, a box of oranges, a box of grapes, and a box of mangos.

She is 59 years old, is married, and has 3 children. One of her children is economically independent. Her husband works in agriculture, and both of them work to manage the costs of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian, se dedica a la venta D. golosinas y abarrotes, en el distrito D. Chiquian, provincia D. Bolognesi, departamento D. Ancash.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 les, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 2 sacos D. arroz, 2 sacos D. azúcar, una caja D. aceite, un saco D. sal, 2 paquetes D. detergente, una caja D. manzana, una caja D. naranja, una caja D. uva, una caja D. mango.

Ella tienen 59 años D. edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos uno D. ellos es independiente, su esposo es agricultor y ambos se apoyan con los gastos D. su hogar.

loans.use: To buy products to sell at the general store

loans.name: Khadija's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Khadija is married and has two children (ages 4 and 7). She sells used clothing, a business she started last year. She works from 9 A.M. to 6 P.M. daily and makes a monthly profit of about $18.

Khadija hopes for a loan to purchase more clothing to sell. She will be sharing this loan with Nadhira and Tatu, members of the Furaha loan group (which means "laughter" in Swahili). These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Albertina Alberto

texts.en:
Albertina is 46 years old and originally from the capital city of Maputo. She is married and supports 16 people, of which eight are her own children.

Albertina lived most of her life with her grandmother, helping with household duties when she was not studying or working at the family’s machamba, a small agricultural field. When Albertina married, her husband finished building their house in CaT., a fishing village that is a 10-minute ferry boat ride away from Maputo, where she still lives. Albertina worked for many years at CIMA, a manufacturing company that produces fishing nets. She quit because she became ill. After she was better, she started to sell products bought in the neighboring country of Swaziland. But the profits were insignificant so Albertina decided to change jobs again.

In 2000 she built a small restaurant at CaT.’s central market, where she sells prepared food and drinks. Albertina works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. She counts on the help of her eldest daughter whenever she has to be away from the business. Albertina’s daily income varies from MTn 500 to MTn 1,000, depending on the time of the month and the season. Her greatest difficulty is the clients that promise to pay at the end of the month and don’t. Albertina buys all her products in Maputo, and says that beer, wine and soda are her most profitable items for sale.

With this MTn 14,000 loan, Albertina intends to buy drinks to stock (beer, wine and soft drinks), and also raw material to cook, such as chicken, rice and oil. In the future Albertina would like to diversify the products offered to her clients and grow her business.

loans.use: Buy inventory and raw materials (drinks and food to cook)

loans.name: Thi Yen's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Yen (ID number: 070034), 54 years old, would like to borrow 2,714,000 VND to invest in her eatery. Her group had already borrowed one time before and repaid fully. The loan enabled her to purchase more stocks and thus, her daily profit was higher than before. She was able to save for her family. She has one child who is attending college. Her family's average daily income is about 100,000 VND (about 6.5 USD). Her group consists of:

Mrs. N. Thi Dinh (ID number: 070035), borrows 2,478,000 VND to purchase more woods to make furniture.

Mrs. N. Thi Hien (ID number: 070036), borrows 2,478,000vVND to purchase more woods to make furniture.

Mrs. N. Thi Le (ID number: 070038), borrows 2,478,000 VND to invest in her butcher shop.

Mrs. N. Thi Hoi (ID number: 070039), borrows 2,478,000 VND to purchase more rice to make cake.

Mrs. N. Thi Son (ID number: 070042), borrows 2,006,000 VND to breed chickens and pigs.
