Mrs. N. Thi Linh (ID number: 070043), borrows 2,006,000 VND to purchase more construction materials to sale.

The total amount requested is 1,050.00 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn Thi Yên (MS: 070034), năm nay 54 tuổi. Vay 2.714.000 VND về bán hàng ăn. Cô cùng nhóm đã vay được một chu kỳ và hoàn trả xong. Lần một cô vay về mua được nhiều hàng hơn nên mức lãi hàng ngày cô thu được nhiều hơn. Cô đã tiết kiệm được hơn cho gia đình. Cô có một con đang đi học cao đẳng. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô khoảng 100.000 VND/ngày. Trong nhóm cô còn có: Chị Nguyễn Thị Dinh (MS: 070035), vay 2.478.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua gỗ đóng bàn ghế. Chị Nghiêm Thị Hiền (MS: 070036), vay 2.478.000 VND mua gỗ đóng bàn ghế. Chị Nguyễn Thị Lệ (MS: 070038), vay 2.478.000 VND để bổ sung vốn buôn bán thịt lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồi (MS: 070039), vay 2.478.000 VND để mua gạo làm bánh. Chị Nguyễn Thị Sơn (MS: 070042), vay 2.006.000 VND về chăn nuôi gà lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Lĩnh (MS: 070043), vay 2.006.000 VND bổ xung vốn mua vật liệu xây dựng bán.

loans.use: Retail and agriculture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in fashionable jewelry and move her business forward

loans.name: Mashavu

texts.en:
Mashavu is 49 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 20, 11 and 7 years old. She is a charcoal and firewood seller. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mashavu now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to increase her stock.

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Panamericana podemos encontrar a la asociación “San Pablo”  a la fecha cuenta con nueve miembros activos que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace más de siete años. 
Diversos son los negocios de esta asociación  por ejemplo algunas de ellas tienen una mini- distribuidora de perfumes de marca( Reblon), Sonia es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, Luz al igual que otras de sus compañeras se dedican a la venta de electrodomésticos que por lo general los dejan a crédito a instituciones   y personas particulares. La mayoría de ellas son casadas y con hijos siendo Lidia y Verónica las únicas solteras del grupo, pero de la misma forma que sus compañeras trabajan para mantener económicamente a sus familias.
Todas ellas quieren ampliar sus ventas por lo que necesitan comprar mayor cantidad de productos, para generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
In the Panamerican focal center we find the "San Pablo" association, which to date has nine active members who work together with Kiva partner Pro-Mujer for more than seven years. The members' businesses are diverse, for example, some of the women run a small brand-name (Reblon) perfume distribution; Sonia is owner of a convenience store, and Luz is as well; other members sell electric appliances on credit to institutions and certain people. The majority of the members are married with children — Lidia and Verónica are the only single members in the group — and all are untied by the goal to work for their families' economic stabilities. All of the women want to increase their sales, which in turn means they need to buy a larger quantity of supplies, so they can generate more earnings to allow them to improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products to increase their sales

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: ASSANE D. EST ROPIETAIRE D'UN MAGASIN DE QUINCAILLERIE AU QUARTIER MEDINA FAL DE THIES DEPUIS 18 MOIS. IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE 02 ENFANTS. IL COMMERCIALISE DU CIMENT, DU FER, ET DIVERS MATERIELS DE CONSTRUCTION.
texts.en:
ASSANE D. has been the owner of a hardware store in the MEDINA FAL district of THIES for 18 months. He is married and the father of two. He markets cement, iron, and various construction materials.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in hardware

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina A. started up her local restaurant twenty years ago in Ashaiman, where she resides. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 56 years old, and she is married with three children, all of whom are currently in school. She serves a wide variety of local dishes such as fufu, rice balls, banku, and ampesi, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains, and it is eaten with soup. Meanwhile, banku is prepared from milled maize grains, and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. And, ampesi is a boiled plantain or yam, and it is taken with any stew.

She is now seeking a loan to buy more raw materials, including bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meats, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Moreover, Wilhelmina hopes to use part of the loan proceeds to finance her children’s education.

She is a member of the community group known as the Voice Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. Wilhelmina notes that her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional ingredients and materials (e.g., maize, cassava, plantains, meats, fish, vegetables, and firewood)

loans.name: Dyagombwa

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is thirty-two year old Dyagombwa N. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, aged five and ten. Dyagombwa has been running a beauty salon since 2005. This client’s business is in selling long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, and blue hair, and then having it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by two employees.

Dyagombwa currently earns about 600 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to buy more women's long hair for resale. In the future, she plans to open another beauty salon. Dyagombwa thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more women's long hair for resale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Helen M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child who is 16 years old. Helen has been running a grocery business since 2000. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Helen currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 225 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soda. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Helen thanks you for your support. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soda.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena Matemba runs a grocery shop at Mbagala in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is an entrepreneur business woman with three school-aged children. She has been running the business for 3 years. She sells a variety of items, including wheat flour, maize flour, ground nuts, cashew nuts, and sugar.

Income derived from the business is used to meet her family's daily needs and pay school fees. She requests a loan of $625 (800,000 TZS) to purchase more items to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell in the shop

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: Намозов Раджабмурод житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 25 лет, женат  и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей крупно рогатого скота. Покупает на одном рынке а продает на другом уже подороже. Бизнес приносит неплохой доход , но теперь он планирует получить кредит и увеличить поголовье скота. Это даст возможность больше заработать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabmurod N. lives in Abdurahmoni Jomi. He is 25 years old and is married with three children. He has a high school diploma and is involved in livestock sales. He buys livestock at one market and sells it at a profit at nother. The business is profitable, and Rajabmurod would like to get a loan and purchase more livestock. This would help him make more money. He would be able to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Etsé

texts.fr: Monsieur A. etsé  est un homme marié, il a 02 enfants, il réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’adidogomé. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille est la vente de friperie. Il fait son commerce depuis 2004 et s’approvisionne au marché local de hedzranawoé où ce commerce est très développé. Il veut rehausser son stock, raison pour laquelle il sollicite de wages un crédit pour  achat de friperie.
texts.en:
A. Etsé is a married man. He has two children and lives with his family in the neighbourhood of Adidogomé. He sells second-hand clothing in order to make money and support his family. He has been in this business since 2004 and gets his stock from the local market of Hedzranawoé which is a hub for the used-clothing business. He wishes to increase his stock of clothing which is why he is asking Wages for this loan to buy second-hand clothes.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Reimera

texts.es:
La señora Reimera, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Victorias”, vive en el Jr. Leticia Nº 691, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 60 años y es madre 04 hijos, todos independientes.

Se inicio con  S/. 20.00 de capital, empezó vendiendo anticuchos de pollo en las  afueras de su casa, donde poco a poco fue comprando sus implementos para sus ventas. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad, se dedica a la venta de comidas elaboradas por ella misma, siendo sus principales clientes  los moradores de la comunidad, vecinos y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/2.000.00 que cancelara en un plazo de 06 meses, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Ella toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Reimera, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Reimera belongs to the "Las Victorias" Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Leticia Nº 691, in the District of Juanjui, in the San Martín area. She lives with her partner, is 60 years old and is the mother of 4 children, all of whom are independent. She began with S/ 20.00 in capital and started selling chicken skewers in the area near her house, where, little by little, she started buying supplies for sale. She has been working with the bank for 2 years. Currently, she sells food she makes herself, and her main customers are the residents of the community, her neighbors and friends. With this loan of S/2.000.00 that she will repay within 6 months, she wants to invest in the purchase of materials for for daily food preparatio, such as sacks of rice, sugar, oil packets, chicken and also tables, chairs, glasses and pots in order to set up her business and give better service to her customers. She makes the decisions regarding her business earnings. Today, she feels like an independent woman, more responsible by making her payments. Reimera expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and as a business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale foods (rice, sugar, oils, chicken) and tables, chairs, glasses and pots.

loans.name: Birungi Lilian‘S Group

texts.en:
Lilian is 38 years of age, a single mother of three children aged between 10 and 14. She owns a three-roomed house where she is living with four people and she doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Lilian sells sweet bananas in Naguru Market, in one of the city suburbs. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from suppliers who get them from the villages; that is how she earns her living. Her monthly expenses include rent for her place of work and school fees for her children.

Lilian sells to all categories of people and works six days week. She has done this business for over four years now This is her tenth loan since she joined MCDT; she has been with MCDT for five years, working with the same group mates. Lilian wants to use this loan to buy more bananas and partly to pay school fees for her children. She is aspiring to see her business growing bigger and hopes to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and to pay school fees

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (1037061100) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has four school-aged children. To making a living, V. owns & operates a manufacturing business venture.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tailoring.  V. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2000, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.  V. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to invest in her business.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Melania Pérez de 42 años de edad, vive en un barrio de la capital de Managua Villa Reconciliación, casada, su esposo se desempeña como albañil, tiene tres hijos. Dentro de sus planes la construcción de su casa es un hecho que ha corto plazo realizaran. Doña Melania mujer emprendedora que tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa desde hace siete años, iniciándolo con fondo propio y pocas cantidades de productos. Le da las gracias  Afodenic por la oportunidad que le brinda con el préstamo para crecer y mejorar su nivel de vida. Este es su noveno ciclo  y lo va invertir en la  compra de productos como: ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, nuevos productos de uso cotidianos para incrementar su inventario y captar nuevos clientes.

loans.use: Comprar ropa para dama y caballeros

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en: Ramota sells provisions, jewelry and cosmetics in her shop. Ramota is 42 years old and married with four children. Ramota is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and jewelry to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and jewelry

loans.name: Beti

texts.es:
La señora Beti, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 45 años, 04 hijos, 02 que aun están bajo su poder y están estudiando.

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera a diario le ayuda a mejorar el ingreso económico de su familia. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará sacos de arroz y azúcar, fideos, sal y aceite en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Beti, se siente muy bien, para continuar trabajando y se prepara día a día para asumir los retos  que la vida le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Beti belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” in the Moyobamba District, San Martin Province, Department of San Martin. She is married, 45 years old and has 4 children, 2 of whom she is still responsible for and are studying.

Her strength and desire to give her children a future motivated her to start up her own business selling groceries, which she runs from her home in an environment that has been tailored to best serve her customers.

Her daily earnings enable her to increase her family’s income. From the day she started out, she has been winning customers and now she has regulars who come to her each day because they can buy all the products that a housewife needs and she personally serves them with her characteristic kindness and charm.

With this loan of 2,500 soles she will buy bags of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, salt and oil, milk and various brands of tinned fish, eggs and personal hygiene products so as to continue offering the best service to her customers.

Beti is glad to continue with her work and prepares every day to meet life’s challenges. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like herself to have opportunities and develop in their professions.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to add to her product range

loans.name: Our God Is Able Group

texts.en: Sayea has never been to school. She is married and has two children, ages 30 and 43 years old. Her husband is currently a college student. She has been selling dry goods, such as oil, pepper, and salt, for over 10 years in the Old Road area. She said, “My customers are attracted because I have more good on my table and approach my customers so well”. She dreams of having a bigger business to support herself and her grandchildren.

loans.use: Additional fresh goods for her sales table

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel es una carismática mujer D. 52 años, vive con su esposo Ernesto D. 55 años, quien trabaja en el puerto, y con su hijo Enzo D. 29 años. La casa donD. viven es propia. DesD. hace un año se dedica a la elaboración D. collares, pulseras y aretes, los cuales aprendió a confeccionar con la técnica D. bisutería. Esta actividad le está arrojando buenos ingresos económicos, además D. los negocios paralelos que tiene, pues también posee un motocarro que alquila a diario, elabora diversas manualidades y hace poco incursionó en la venta D. zapatos por pedido. Los deseos D. trabajar y D. progresar D. Ysabel son los motivos para ponerle tanta dedicación a su trabajo, el cual poco a poco va creciendo. Ella siempre está pensando en algún negocio nuevo que pueda poner en pie, pues no quiere depender sólo del trabajo D. su esposo. Aunque tener que estar pendiente D. tantas actividades la cansa, esto no es razón para que deje D. trabajar, más bien todo lo contrario, ella se exige mucho más y ya es costumbre ese ritmo D. trabajo. A futuro, Ysabel quiere expandir sus negocios y lograr mejores ingresos económicos. Con éste, son 15 los préstamos que ha tenido con MFP y cada uno D. ellos la han ayudado a sacar adelante sus negocios. Por su parte, siempre ha demostrado puntualidad y gran aprecio a las personas con las que trabajó en grupo, pues este es su primer préstamo individual. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en tres D. sus negocios: comprará materiales para elaborar más joyas, incrementará su mercadería en zapatos y refaccionará su motocarro.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a charismatic woman of 52. She lives with her husband Ernesto, age 55, who works with their son Enzo (age 29) at the harbor. The family owns their house. For a year Ysabel has worked making necklaces, bracelets, and earrings, which she learned to make at a technical school for costume jewelery. This work is bringing her good income, along with the other small businesses she has. She owns a motor-taxi that she rents daily, makes a variety of handicrafts, and recently started selling catalog-order shoes. Ysabel's desire to work and make progress motivate her dedication to her work, which continues to grow. She is always thinking of new businesses that she could start, as she doesn't want to depend only on her husband. Although having so many activities makes her tired she doesn't think it's a reason to stop working; on the contrary, she demands more of herself and is already used to the workload. In the future, Ysabel wants to expand her businesses and earn better income. This loan will be her 15th with MFP and each loan has helped her advance her businesses. On her part, she has always been punctual and very appreciative of her fellow group members. This is her first individual loan. The money she requests will be invested in 3 of her businesses: she will buy materials to make more jewelery, increase her stock of shoes, and refurbish her motor-taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase investment capital.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
She believes that for poor people like her, the most precious legacy she can leave her children is the education that she strives hard to provide them in their formative years.  This is the purpose that drives Alfreda S. of Sitio Cambagting, Barangay Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negrow Occidental.  At 49 years old, Alfreda is married with 4 growing children ages 8, 10, 12 and 18.

Now that her oldest child has started college, she is working doubly hard to earn more money in order to cover the household expenses as well as send her kids to school. In addition to her pig fattening business she is also always on the lookout for other opportunities to supplement her income.  She is optimistic that if she exerts all of her efforts toward her goal, she will be able to achieve her dream to have all of her children finish college and have a better life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy more pigs.

loans.name: Fadimata Sidi

texts.fr:
Madame  Fadimata Sidi K.  est âgée de 38 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 7 enfants en location avec d’autres ménages dans le quartier Hamdallaye B de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons familiales (puisque appartenant à une famille de pêcheur toujours en transhumance), elle commença très tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait les poissons que pêchait son père. En plus de la vente du poisson sous toutes ses formes, frais, fumés et séché ; elle vendait également des fruits et légumes tels la mangue, les agrumes etc. Toujours soucieuse de diversifier ses activités, Fadimata ajoute une autre activité à son arc en entamant  la fabrication de glace alimentaire et de jus à base de fruits et d’arômes artificiels depuis maintenant 7 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle composée de toutes les catégories.
Dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son 1er prêt individuel.
Ce prêt servira à acheter, 1 congélateur. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou.  Fadimata Sidi K. effectue ses  ventes au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000FCFA,qui lui permettra de faire de l’embouche bovine et ovine, de payer des habits et  des médicaments pour elle et ses enfants. 
Son ambition est de construire une maison pour enfin quitter la location.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fadimata Sidi K., 38, lives with her husband and her 7 children in rented quarters together with other households in the Hamdallaye B neighborhood of the town of Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Never having attended school due to family reasons (she belonged to a family of fishermen who were always following good fishing sites), she began very early on to earn her living together with her mother who sold the fish her father caught. Besides selling fish in all its forms (fresh, smoked and dried), she also sold fruit and vegetables such as mangoes, citrus fruit, etc. Always eager to diversify her business, Fadimata added another branch, beginning to sell food-grade ice and juice made of fruit and of artificial flavoring. She has been doing that for 7 years now and has a wide clientele from all walks of life.

In view of growing her working capital so as to respond to the demand of her clientele, she turned to the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom she is on her first individual loan. This loan will be used to buy a freezer. She does her buying right there in Segou. She sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000 F CFA which will allow her to fatten cattle and sheep and pay for clothing and medicine for herself and her children.

Her ambition is to build a home so that they will finally not have to rent any more.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a freezer

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El caballero Luis Alberto B. es padre con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos en edad escolar siendo ellos el motivo por el cual él se esfuerza grandemente para llevarles el sustento. Acaba de iniciar la reconstrucción de su vivienda ya que ha estado en malas condiciones y requiere brindarle a sus hijos un techo digno donde vivir.

Por ello, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con la obra de mejoramiento de su vivienda y así alcanzar que sus hijos se sientan satisfechos con su padre.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She is 27 years old and married with two children, She lives in Edo State, Nigeria.

Philomena is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase a fridge and generator. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge and generator

loans.name: Benita Milena

texts.es: La Señora Benita se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que gracias a esta pequeña actividad ha logrado salir adelante. Ella no tuvo la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios por lo que solamente tiene educación primaria, ella es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, el cual lucha cada día por ofrecerle los estudios necesarios. Benita solicita este financiamiento para la compra de sus productos por lo que tendrá mucha más oportunidad de ofrecerle a sus clientes lo que necesitan. Lo que ella desea es que su negocio se convierta en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Benita owns a general store, and has run this store for more than five years. Thanks to this modest activity, she has been able to prosper. She never had the opportunity to finish her studies, so she only has a primary education. She is a single mother, caring for one child, and she fights every day to provide him his necessary studies. Benita seeks this loan for the purchase of more products so that she can a better chance to provide her clients with what they need. Her wish is to eventually convert her business into a full distribution company.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elivanie's Group

texts.en:
Elivanie is 30 years old, married with 4 children with ages between 5 and 12 years old. Elivanie lives in the Gicumbi district which is approximately one hour drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Since 2007, Elivanie has owned a shop selling some household items as her photo indicates I mean Household items such as Margarine, Sugar,Thermos, Radio, Handbags.


Elivanie is requesting her first loan from Kiva Lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her shop through purchasing more items such as thermos, radio, Handbags and some other needed household items for sale, which, she hopes,will attract more customers as well as increase her sales and profits.  As she builds her business, Elivanie will continue to provide more and better food for her children and build a secure future for them.

loans.use: Household items such asMargarine, Sugar,Thermos, Radio, Handbags,....

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 30 years old and married with two children, who are both attending school. She has a boutique in the Kayole area of Nairobi and sells new clothes and cosmetics. She's been in this business for three years and previously worked as a waiter.

She requested this loan for Kes. 50,000 to increase her inventory. She describes herself as hardworking, and she hopes to open up a hairdressing school in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 10 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella. Elvira no estudió y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
La socia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar ovejas y gallinas.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su tienda en Ilave.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Elvira has been a member of the "Gran Poder" communal bank for ten years, in Llave District, El Collao Province, Puno Department. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children, two who live with her. Elvira did not attend school, and she buys and sells livestock. Elvira tells us that with her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was S/. 300 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan of S/. 500 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to buy sheep and hens. Her dream for the future is to have a store in Llave. What she most likes about her communal bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep and hens

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Sonia tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos y todos sus hijos dependen de ella: José Carlos tiene 9 años, Rosmery tiene 6 años, Lizandro tiene 4 años y Yuliana tiene 2 años y todos estudian en el colegio. La socia Sonia es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia tiene que madrugar para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y almuerzo para su esposo y sus hijos. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a las 6 de la mañana al mercado “Sidrachayoc” a vender frutas hasta las 5 de la tarde. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido buen bien gracias al empeño que en su trabajo. La socia nos cuenta que los días lunes y jueves, viaja a la ciudad de Quillabamba para traer las frutas en camiones. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mas frutas como plátanos, papayas y muchas más.    

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

La ciudad de Urubamba se encuentra a 78 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a una hora y media de viaje. La ciudad de Urubamba se halla en el corazón del Valle Sagrado. En la época prehispánica fue un centro agrícola muy importante.
texts.en:
Our member Sonia is 30 years old, is married and has four kids. All of her kids depend on her: José Carlos is 9 years old, Rosmery is 6, Lizandro is 4 and Yuliana is 2. All of them are in school. Sonia is from the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco and she belongs to the JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI Village Bank, part of the Arariwa Association. She has to get up early to do her household chores such as making breakfast and lunch for her husband and children. Then she goes to the Sidrachayoc market at 6 in the morning to sell fruit until 5 in the afternoon. She has been in business for two years and things are going well thanks to her determination. She tells us that Mondays and Thursdays she travels to the city of Quillabamba to bring back fruit. She needs the loan to buy more fruit such as bananas, papayas and many others. She is very greatful for the opportunity given her by this program and she is committed to pay back the loan on time. The city of Urubamba is 78 km from the city of Cusco, approximately an hour and a half away. The city of Urubamba is found in the heart of the Valle Sagrado. In the pre-hispanic era, it was a very important center of agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit such as bananas and papayas.

loans.name: Ket's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who are led by Mrs. Ket S., located in Chong Koh village, Kandal province. The members of the group will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Ket S. and her husband, Mr. Khorn Thorn, are farmers who own a 2.5-hectare field where they cultivate rice. They do not have enough money to support the field, so Mrs. Ket S. decided to ask for 400,000 KHR from the Kiva field partner, AMK (Angkor Microfinance Kampuchea), to buy gasoline and fertilizer to help with their farming. 

Mr. Khorn Thorn is a fisherman who can earn a small income to help his family members. Mrs. Ket S. is the mother of five children, three of whom are students in the local school, while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and fertilizer

loans.name: John Kiberu

texts.en:
John is a single gentleman aged 27 years old. He has been working in the bicycle transport business for the past two years.

He was introduced to Kadet through an existing Kadet client. He is planning to purchase another bicycle and employ somebody else. With the extra profit generated from the business, John intends to purchase a motorcycle for transport.

His hopes and dreams are to buy a Nissan Matatu (Minibus) for transport and employ more people, especially young, jobless men who do not have much education to get employment elsewhere. John is hard-working despite insecurity in his area of operations. He tells of a story where he once carried a client who later robbed him and took off with his bicycle. He did not give up, but rather bought another bicycle and continued with the business. John describes himself as hardworking man who is God-fearing and honest.

loans.use: To purchase a bicycle.

loans.name: Kenhinde

texts.en:
Kenhinde K. is a business woman who lives in Lagos State with her family. Kenhinde is 30 years old, married with two children. Both are in school. 

Kenhinde makes her living by selling drinks to retail customers. She has been in this business for three years. As a hardworking woman, she also sells pepper, soup, fruit, and juices in order to make additional profit. With the profit she makes from her business she has been able to support her family. 

Kenhinde is requesting a loan of 140,000 Nigerian Naira (NGN) to purchase more drinks, pepper, soup, and spices. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, pepper, soup, and spices for resale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una buena mujer de 51 años, tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos viven en otra ciudad y ella vive con su esposo y una de sus hijas que es madre soltera.

Anteriormente trabajaba como ama de llaves, con este sueldo apoyó en los gastos del hogar a su esposo (planchador de carros) y ambos cubrieron la educación de sus hijos. Ahora acaba de empezar en el negocio de la venta de ropa en el puesto de una amiga situado en el mercado de su localidad. Por el momento Juana está tratando de captar clientela para que en adelante se independice y trabaje junto a su hija.

Este es segundo crédito con MFP y promete cumplir con responsabilidad en sus pagos, como con el primero. Asimismo, manifiesta estar agradecida con las demás integrantes de su banco comunal y promete no defraudar su confianza. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de prendas de vestir y de ese modo incrementar el capital de su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana, 51, is a terrific person. She has 4 children, 3 of whom live in another city. She lives with her husband and one of their daughters, a single mother. Juana used to work as a housekeeper and, with the money she earned, she helped her husband pay for household expenses and their children's school fees. She has just started a business selling clothing in a stall owned by a friend at a local market. For now, she is trying to establish a customer base so that she can build an independent business that she can ultimately share with her daughter. This is Juana's second MFP loan and she is committed to repaying this one, just like she did the first one. She says, too, that she feels indebted to the other members of her community bank and she promises not to betray their trust. She will use the money that she is applying for to buy articles of clothing and, in turn, build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua N. K. is twenty two years old, married to a housewife and they do not have any children yet. His business is located at Kiganjo mali area in Nairobi. He has been selling flour, sugar, rice, detergents etc for one year now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in future. He is very hardworking and patient.

loans.use: Flour, sugar, rice, soap etc

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en: Battulga is 44 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. During the day, Battulga operates a second hand shoe trading business with his wife at a local market. He and his wife, Gerelmaa, sometimes repair shoes before they sell them to their customers if it is necessary. They have been operating their business since 2006, and have expanded it over the last four years. Battulga's oldest son, Bayrjargal, a university student, also helps with his parents business when he has free time. Recently, Battulga has started to sell shoes out of another counter in addition to their old one. As Battulga's sales channels expand, he expects that his business will grow as well. Battulga is an experienced trader and a very hardworking person. He says, “It's the first time that I am receiving service from XacBank. They have quick and convenient service.” He is requesting a 1,800,000-tugrug loan to purchase more inventory to supply his new counter.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G., from the village of Amoyong, Wao Lanao Del Sur, is 47 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn operates a business venture providing trucking services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be Merlyn's second loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Lucky Group

texts.en:
Lucky M., the leader of a group of five borrowers called Lucky Group, is a 32-year-old single mother of three children, 12 and 13 years old. Lucky did not have the opportunity to go to school due to lack of financial support.

For the past three years she has been selling foodstuffs such as pepper, oil, salt and seasonings at the Old Road Community Market in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. Lucky started selling with 1,200 Liberian Dollars as working capital that was given to her by a friend. She sells goods that customers demand in order to keep them returning. Lucky plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to purchase more seasonings, pepper, oil and salts, her ultimate goals being to own a shop and build a house for her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Lucky is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonings, pepper, oil and salts.

loans.name: Lino

texts.es: Lino Salmerón tiene 46 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado. Este no es el primer financiamiento que se le ha otorgado, pues ha demostrado que es una persona responsable y que disfruta de su trabajo. Tiene 4 hijos pero 2 de ellos viven por cuenta propia y 2 están bajo su cuido, empezó su trabajo desde hace 13 años hasta que su esposa le dio la idea de mejorar su actividad, el es una persona muy humilde. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para comprar terneros, vacas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es lograr que sus hijos lleguen a la universidad.
texts.en:
Lino Salmerón, age 46, buys and sells livestock. This is not the first loan that he has had. He has demonstrated that he is a responsible person who enjoys his work. He has four children. Two of them live on their own, and two are under his care. He started this work 13 years ago. His wife gave him the idea of improving his activity. He is a very humble person. The loan he is requesting is for working capital to buy calves and cows among other things. His wish is that his children attend the university.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Salcost Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Salcost” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Wara T. who is pictured second from right. Wara is age 28 and was born in Makeni. She is single with one child who is attending primary school.  For many years now, Wara has been selling palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), vegetable oil, and rice. Wara will use her share of the loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, vegetable oil, and rice

loans.name: Las Originales Group

texts.es:
Las Originales grupo conformado por Juana O., Darling S. y Deyanira Hernández tres mujeres esforzadas, emprendedoras y luchadoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora O. comerciante de calzado. Ella inicio el negocio con este negocio hace siete años junto con su esposo quien se encarga de la producción mientras ella los distribuye en la zona franca.
La meta de O. es ampliar su negocio en especial por las ventas de agosto y llegar a tener su propia tienda.
Las otras dos integrantes del grupo son Darling S. quien desde hace más de tres años vende cosméticos Avon, marca de gran prestigio en Nicaragua y Deyanira Hernández tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde invertirá en telas e hilos.
texts.en:
The Originales group is comprised of Juana O., Darling S., and Deyanira Hernández. These three women are hard-working, enterprising, and tenacious. The coordinator of the group, Mrs. O., is a shoe merchant. She started the business with her husband seven years ago. He is in charge of production while she distributes the shoes in the “Zona Franca” (a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua). Mrs. O.’s goal is to expand her business, especially for the August sales. She also wants to have her own store. Darling S., a member of the group, has been selling Avon cosmetics for over three years. This brand is very prestigious in Nicaragua. Dayanira Hernández, the other group member, has a small seamstress shop. She will buy fabric and thread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Footwear

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 36-year-old married man with two children aged 10 and 2. He has been operating his pharmacy for five years. He also farms to supplement his family’s income. Edward previously operated a cafeteria. He appreciates being a member of Faulu Kenya because he can afford to educate his children and has bought a piece of land. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES to open another pharmacy and a cafeteria.  He hopes to own a pharmaceutical company in the future.

loans.use: To open a pharmacy and a cafeteria

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: N. Joy is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has two children. All of her children are currently in school. Joy has a business selling secondhand clothes, which she has had for three years. To help expand her business, Joy is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes. Joy plans to use the loan in order to expand her business and generate profit in order to help her children. In the future, Joy hopes to be a big businesswoman. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product on Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future. They target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans and giving Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia de 32 años, es una madre muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su hija, sus padres y hermanas. Hace más de 5 años, se dedica en la venta de ropa masculina, en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de su distrito. Es entonces que atiende a su clientela, desde las 9:30 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, previo a su actividad lleva primero a su hijo al jardín y al medio día  también lo recoge para luego continuar con la venta en compañía de él. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que la mercadería no se pierde y con el tiempo recupera la inversión, además que le genera buenos ingresos económicos, que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de su familia. En adelante planea ampliar su negocio abasteciéndose de prendas femeninas. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en cumplir con responsabilidad en sus pagos, ya que quiere contar con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito solicitado, desea comprar prendas de vestir y de ese modo incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 32, is a very hard-working mother. She lives in her parents’ house with her parents and sisters. She has been selling men's clothing at a stand located in her district market. She waits on her customers from 9:30 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. Before she starts works she takes her son to nursery school. At midday she goes to get him, and she then continues selling while he is with her. What she likes most about her business is that you do not lose the merchandise. In time you recuperate the investment. Also, it generates good income, which helps her cover the family expenses. Later she plans to expand her business and stock it with women’s clothing. This is her first loan with MFP. She pledges to responsibly make her payments because she wants to have future help. She will use the requested loan to buy clothing. That way she will increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on clothing to increase her earnings

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: La Sra. Raquel U. G. es trabajadora activa del Centro de Salud “San Rafael del Sur”   ella  se desempeña  como Secretaria Ejecutiva, tiene  dieciocho años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  doce créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para cambio de techo de unos de los curtos de su casa, los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Raquel U. G. works at the San Rafael del Sur Health Center as an executive secretary. She has worked there for eighteen years. She is currently married. She has had twelve loans from CEPRODEL, which she has used to purchase construction materials to improve her house. She is asking for this loan to replace the ceiling in one of the rooms in her house. Her loans from Ceprodel have benefited her, and she has been able to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to replace a ceiling

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina M., 47, is married with five children.  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Tina has three years of experience in this business.  Tina needs a loan of 2500 talas to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Tina joined SPBD. This is her fourth loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tina's only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Aljane

texts.en:
Aljane F. is from the village of Poblacion 2 in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married, and has an infant. To make a living, Aljane owns and operates a retail store, while not the only means of generating revenue the main source of income is from selling clothes like blouses and others in the local community.Aljane engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.  


In 2009, Aljane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan of 15000 PHP used to to repair a business transport vehicle. Aljane is requesting her third loan, for 20000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 26-year-old married man, father of five children, living with them and with his beloved wife in Tyre, where he works painting houses. Mouhamad’s work is not limited to a certain area, because his clients request him from different regions, since he is experienced and enjoys a high reputation among competitors. 

He is requesting a loan for the second time from Al Majmoua, in order to improve his tools and to buy necessary products for his business. It’s Mouhamad’s only source of livelihood because he didn’t continue his studies, and he learned this business from his childhood. He intends to update his business and himself with all new products and designs to attract new clients in the future.

loans.use: To improve his tools and to buy necessary products for his business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria S. C. es trabajador de la Escuela Efrain Tijerino de Chinandega, se desempeña como  maestra de primaria desde hace 27 años, es  soltera tiene 04 hijos pero solo 02 dependen de ella,  habita en el Barrio Roberto Gonzalez, lleva 02 años trabajando con CEPRODEL, ha obtenido 02 creditos con los cuales ha mejorado su condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ana Maria S. C. works at the Tijerino de Chinandega school. She has been a primary school teacher for 27 years. She is single with four children, but only two of them are dependent on her. She lives in the Roberto Gonzalez neighborhood. She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and has so far received 2 loans that have enabled her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Buy materials (bricks and cement).

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is requesting for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy computers for her Internet cafe. She runs "Mother's Choice", an internet cafe in a busy part of Nairobi. She employs two people and has been in this business for eight years. Her customers are mainly low and middle income earners. At the age of 46, Gladys is a single mother of a fifteen year old who is in school. She hopes to own and run a big computer supply firm in the future. She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 24 years old and married.  Evariste owns a small business selling stones for construction and has eight years experience in his business.  He employs 17 people in his business and works from 6am until 5pm.  

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand his business.  Evariste will use this loan to purchase additional stones and other tools. Evariste will be able to attract more customers and earn more profit.  With this profit, Evariste will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: To invest in more tools and stones

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es: El señor  Cornelio nacido el 16 de septiembre en Vallegrande, es casado y  tiene 3 hijos mayores ya independientes, se dedica a la agricultura Hace 3 años el viene trabajando solo con EMPRENDER con el primer crédito compro terreno, con el segundo compro su parcela cerca de la carretera y con este crédito va a comprar una Motosierra para sacar madera. También se dedica a la ganadería, cría ovejas y vacas, vende también leche a una institución muy conocida de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es una  persona muy trabajadora y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Sr. Cornelio, born September 16, in Vallegrande, is married with 3 grown children, all now grown.  He operates a farming business.  Three years ago, he started working with EMPRENDER, using his first loan to buy land.  He used his second loan to buy a parcel of land near the highway and he will use this loan to buy a chainsaw for cutting timber.  Sr. Cornelio also raises cattle and sheep.  He sells milk to a well-known company in the city of Santa Cruz.  Sr. Cornelio is a hard-working man and committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Chainsaw for timber business.

loans.name: Crsitina

texts.es: Cristina, de 38 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 2 hijos menores; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 4 años, esta laboriosa dama se dedica a la venta de comida (menús) por su zona. Se despierta cada mañana y empieza con la preparación de los 20 platillos que debe entregar al mediodía a sus habituales comensales, que la prefieren por los buenos precios y la exquisitez de sus comidas. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le ha permitido durante todos estos años sacar adelante a sus hijos; además durante los fines de semana sus hijos le ayudan en la repartición de los platos. Esta muy contenta y por eso tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un negocio de venta de balones de gas, o también manifiesta que podría ser un locutorio, aún no se decide pero tiene en claro que quiere seguir progresando. Es el 12avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando para salir adelante. Cristina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de balones de gas que necesita para empezar a implementar el negocio que instalará, pues tiene el anhelo de instalar un negocio fijo para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cristina is 38 years old.  She lives in her own home with her two dependent children.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead in life.  For four years, this hard-working lady has been selling meals in her area.  She gets up every morning and begins making the 20 meals that she must deliver at midday to her regular customers who prefer her meals because they are a good price and taste delicious.

Cristina likes her work a lot as it has allowed her, over the years, to get her children ahead in life.  Her children help her to deliver her meals on the weekends.  Cristina is very happy and has many plans for the future such as setting up a business selling natural gas cylinders.  She would also perhaps like to set up a 'locutorio' (an establishment that provides telephone booths for public use).  She is still not certain but she is certain that she would like to continue making progress.

This is Cristina's 12th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments punctually.  She doesn't want to let down the people who are making this support possible as it will enable her to continue working to get ahead in life.  Cristina plans to invest her loan in buying natural gas cylinders that she needs to begin to set up her business.  She would like to set up a regular business to guarantee her children's future.

loans.use: To buy natural gas cylinders to set up her new business

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao S. is a hard-working woman who spent most of her life farming. She has a life partner in her husband, who helps her in the farm field. This couple earns an income of around $6 a day to support the expenses for the whole family. They have two children, both are employed as workers in a factory in Kompong Tom Province. 

Presently, Sao S. would like to do dry-season rice farming, but she does not have enough capital.  Sao S. is asking for a loan to buy a pumping machine, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy pump, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Miriam Oneida

texts.es:
la sra. Miriam Oneida O. E. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un puesto en el cual vende varios productos y esta ubicado en la Terminal de Buses de Jutiapa Jamastran, el crecimiento de su negocio es notable y esto debido a la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes y por la administración que le da al mismo.

Doña Miriam esta casada y de su matrimonio tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen en su totalidad de ellos; pero el esposo de la Sra. Ordóñez migro hace varios años a los EE.UU. en busca de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que ellos no tenían casa donde vivir y desde que su esposo llego a dicho país se propuso la meta de construir su vivienda, misma que ya esta avanzada en mas de un 80% y según lo manifestado por ella su esposo solo termina la construcción de la casa y se regresa de dicho país para poder criar a sus hijos juntos. 
En la actualidad la Sra. O. no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas su negocio. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de  manzanas, tomates, chiles, papas, cebollas, galletas, sopas, jugos, churros, rasuradoras, naranjas, vinagre, frijoles en bolsa, pastas, confites. desea tener mas surtido su negocio y con mas inventario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Miriam Oneida O. E. is a businesswoman. She has a stall in which she sells various products, located in the bus terminal in Jutiapa Jamastran.  Her business has grown noticeably, owing to the good attentions of her customers and her own administration of the business.  

Doña Miriam is married and has 3 children who are totally dependent on them; however, her husband left for the United States some years ago in an attempt to improve their quality of life, since they didn't have a home in which to live.  Once her husband arrived in the US, he proposed that they construct a home, which is now more than 80% complete.  She says that when the house is finished, her husband will return from the US so that they can raise their children together.  

Currently, Mrs. O. does not have sufficient business capital to help her business grow.  She would use the loan to buy apples, tomatoes, peppers, potatoes, onions, cookies, soups, juices, chips, razors, oranges, vinegar, bagged beans, pasta, and candy.  She wants to her business to be better stocked and to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy apples, tomatoes, peppers, potatoes, onions, cookies, soups, juices, chips, razors, oranges, vinegar, bagged beans, pasta and candy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls for her business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma M., 51, is a single mother who has solely provided for her child's education up to college level. Vilma is a college undergraduate who runs a business buying and selling frozen meats, such as sausages, hot dogs, sweetened pork meat, etc. Every day, Vilma makes sure that she earns enough to meet her family's daily needs, including school expenses for her child. Vilma and her child live in Apilo Cruz, Pasay City.

Vilma buys frozen food products from manufacturers at wholesale prices and then sells these items piecemeal with a minimum markup. She also supplies balot (a fertilized duck egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell) to balot vendors in her locality. Vilma earns an estimated monthly income of PHP 10,000.

To help her continue business operations, Vilma would like to request a PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy frozen meats in bulk and to purchase food items ordered in advance by her customers. She will also use the loan to purchase trays of eggs for balot making. Vilma believes she will gain an increase in her earning capacity as a result of this loan. Vilma fervently prays for good health and successful studies for her child. She also hopes to someday establish another outlet for her business.

As a CCT community partner, Vilma faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy frozen meats in bulk

loans.name: Kyabugimbi Intergrated Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: 54-year-old B. Eldard is affiliated to Kyabugimbi Intergrated group-Bushenyi. His main source of income for the past 20 years has been the sale of bicycle spare parts in Kyabugimbi Trading center. Eldard, who is happily married with 7 kids, is also a farmer who grows and sells bananas. He says this business generates around 60,000 shillings profit a week. With this loan, Eldard says he is going to purchase more bicycle spare parts to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bicycle spare parts to resell

loans.name: Learn To Pay Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Learn To Pay” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mohamed C. is the leader of this group. The 29 year old is married to a driver and they have two children. Mohamed has been a businesswoman for seven years now, she sells sugar, rice, oil, soap, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, oil, soap, etc. in large scale to add to her business

loans.name: Chheav

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Cham, Chheav L., age 51, is year-old widowed mother who lives with her six children, five of whom are single and one is married. Two of her children work as garment factory workers. Chheav L. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother, and she always uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Chheav L. doesn’t have enough capital to plant crops this season so she is requesting  a loan to use towards purchasing potato seeds for planting.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La señora Anita  A. M. tiene veinti cuatro años de edad  es casada con el seño Rogaciano Sánchez Sánchez y con quien procero tres hijo que aun están a  su responsabilidad y son: Juan Antonio de ocho años de edad en tercero de primaria, Román Alexander de cuatro años en segundo de preescolar  Ricardo  Damián de tan sólo dos años de edad.

       Ella es la  primera vez que solicita un préstamo y  es para invertirlo en la compra  de ingredientes, como son: hoja de guineo, maíz, carne, aceite, entre otros, para la elaboración de tamales para luego venderlo en la misma localidad, en donde lleva tres años y dos meses en lo que comenta que le bien.

       Su motivación a esta actividad fue porque también quiere aportan con los ingresos de su hogar y su esposo no se vea muy presionado con que solo el sostenga la casa por eso decidió dedicarse a esta actividad que le está dando buen resultado.

       Su más grande de ilusión es que con esta actividad y el préstamo que le han otorgado pueda trabajar para a horrar y con el tiempo tener una taquería, para que con estas dos actividades apoye a su hijos a que estudien.
texts.en:
Anita A. M. is 24 and married to Rogaciano Sánchez Sánchez, with whom she has 3 children that she still cares for: Juan Antonio, 8, is in 3rd grade; Román Alexander, 4, is in the 2nd year of preschool; and Ricardo Damián is only 2 months old.  

This is the first time Anita has requested a loan.  She plans to use it to invest in ingredients like banana leaves, corn, meat, oil, etc. to make tamales that she sells in her own neighborhood, where she's lived for 3 years and 2 months and says she's doing well.

Anita was motivated because she wanted to help with household expenses and not see her husband under so much pressure as the sole breadwinner, so she decided to start her business and it's bringing good results.

Her fondest wish is that between her job and the loan she was granted, she'll be able to work and save, and in time have a taquería which, along with making tamales, will allow her to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tamales, including meat, banana leaves, ancho chiles, oil, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 34 años, es una mujer muy responsable y virtuosa. Ella tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, hace más de 4 años que inicio este negocio por lo que Julia ya sabía muy bien el su negocio pues fue por sus padres que inicio fue así que experimento y obtuvo buenas ganancias por lo que fue muy importante para empezar este negocio. Julia tiene muchos sueños, pero el que más le gustaría cumplir es de proporcionarle a su vivienda mejoras. El financiamiento que solicita es para cuajada, leche, crema, queso y leche agria.
texts.en: Julia is 34 years old and she is a very responsible and virtuous woman. She has 4 young children. She sells milk products and it was more than 4 years ago that she started this business. Julia already knew the business very well and she started out for her parents. She experimented and her earnings were good so it was very important to start this business. Julia has many dreams but the one she would most like to accomplish is to carry out some home improvements. With the loan that she requests she will purchase cheese curds, milk, cream, cheese, and yogurt.

loans.use: to purchase cheese curds, milk, cream, cheese, and yogurt.

loans.name: Batnyam

texts.en:
Mr. Batnyam is 40 years old, lives with his wife and three daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His elder two daughters attend a secondary school and the youngest one goes to kindergarten. His family lives in a one-bedroom flat which he bought recently. 

Batnyam has been running a clothes retail business at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in the city, since 2003. Batnyam’s wife Myagmarsuren works with her husband  at the market as a salesperson. They sell dresses and casual outerwear which they buy from wholesalers who imports the clothing from China. Even though the market is located outdoors, they work there all year around because the rent is cheaper than for indoor space. 

Batnyam is planning to increase his inventory by buying more clothes for the summer season. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more summer clothes to sell, increasing his working capital and profit.

loans.use: To buy more summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Madelyn is peddling ready-to-wear t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy additional t-shirts and blouses.

Madelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Madelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is married with 4 children.  Manuel is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Manuel is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living.  He has been doing this for 3 years.  He has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase more pigs to raise and sell.  Manuel has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to sell

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
Mme Céline est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 7ans. Tous les quatre(04) vont à l’école. Elle a 07 personnes en charge.

Mme vend du savon liquide depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Gounghin.Ses clients sont ses voisins, amis et dans les services.

Elle veut s’acheter 10 kilogrammes soude, 10kilogrammes de poudre de savon, 11boites de parfuns et 01 boite de colorant.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle aide à la scolarisation de ses enfants et participe aux activités de sa maison. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité, construire une maison et améliorer les conditions de vie de son foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Céline is married and the mother of four children. The oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is seven years old. All four children go to school. She has seven people in her care. 

Mrs. Céline has sold liquid soap for the past five years. She purchases her supplies in the market of Gounghin. Her customers are her neighbors, friends and some businesses. She will purchase ten kilograms of lye, ten kilos of soap powder, 11 boxes of perfumes and one box of dye. 

With her earnings, she will help pay for her children's schooling and her household's expenses. She hopes to grow her business, build a house and improve the living conditions of her home.

loans.use: She will purchase ten kilograms of lye, ten kilos of soap powder, eleven boxes of perfumes and one box of dye.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 57 years old and is a married woman who raises pigs to support her family and provide for their basic needs. She is a blessed mother of three children and her hardworking husband is a carpenter. During six years of raising hogs, Merlinda has been able to earn a net income of 1,000 PHP. 

Merlinda is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy a piglet and feed for her livestock. She believes this loan will greatly help to improve her business and provide a larger income to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a piglet and pig feed

loans.name: Felix Armando

texts.es: El sr. Félix, es un cliente antiguo, esta en su cuarta secuencia de créditos pago puntualmente en su anterior crédito, se dedica a la confección de chamarras y los vende en el interior (Oruro y Potosí) el sr  Félix, es un cliente muy trabajador, joven  con mucha experiencia, hace 10 años que inicio su actividad y oficio, con la confección de chamarras, razón por la cual llegó a equipar su taller con todos los equipos necesarios como:4 maquinas rectas, una overlog, maquina doble y dos prensadoras, todo esto con la ayuda de su familia, que siempre esta a su lado, el Sr.  Félix, vive en  la zona Tembladerani,  es bueno señalar que joven Félix solo trabaja con nuestra institución, el crédito que saco es para la compra de una maquina collareta industrial, y así completar las maquinarias de trabajo que le hacia falta.
texts.en:
Félix is a longstanding client.  This is his fourth loan sequence.  He repaid his previous loan punctually.  He manufactures jackets that he sells in the interior (Oruro and Potosí).  Félix is a very hardworking client.  He’s young but has a lot of experience.  He started his occupation ten years ago making jackets.  Because of this he equipped his workshop with all the necessary equipment.  He has: four straight stitch machines, one overlock, one double machine and two presses.  He has accomplished all this with help from his family who are always by his side.

Félix lives in the Tembladerani zone.  It’s worth mentioning that Félix only works with our institution.  The loan he took out is to buy an industrial collaring machine to add to the machinery he still needed.

loans.use: to buy an industrial collar sewing machine.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 28 years old, comes from Mbale and is married to Edward; they have two children.

Caroline has a business selling clothes and has been doing it for the past nine years. She is applying for her second loan from Kadet Ltd. She has been loaned KES 60,000. Caroline intends to buy more clothes to add to her stock.

She hopes to open up a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 35 years old and single. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Milagros is borrowing PHP 10,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Milagros has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Aiymbubu's Group

texts.en:
Aiymbubu is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a small village near to Isykul Lake. Aiymbubu and her husband are retirees. In order to earn additional money she sews Kyrgyz national blankets and pillows. In this way she earns an additional 1,500 KGS per month. She started this activity two years ago. 

Aiymbubu is applying for the loan because she needs money to contribute some to her grandson’s wedding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan.
