MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to contribute money to her grandson's wedding.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 41 years old, married and has four children.  To make a living, Leonida has been managing her sari-sari store for ten years. She earns about P120 (Philippine Peso) a day for these activities.

According to her, through the income generated from her business, she has been able to give daily allowances to her children in school.

She wishes for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, Leonida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Maria Enriqueta

texts.es: La señora María Enriqueta es una mujer emprendedora que le gusta el oficio del negocio, el cual se dedica a la venta de accesorios que ella misma elabora para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Hace 6 años el esposo adquirió una vivienda de interés social donde actualmente viven,   por una u otra cosa no han podido realizarle mejoras, por tal motivo solicita de un préstamo para comenzar un cuarto en la parte de enfrente para extender su sala comedor y hacer mas amplio uno de las recamaras. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar cemento, varilla, arena y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Señora Maria Enriqueta is an entrepreneurial woman who likes the duties of her business, which is selling accessories that she herself makes in order to help her husband with the household expenses. Six years ago her husband acquired a house in publicly subsidized housing where they now live. For one reason or another, they have not been able to make improvements, and for this reason she is applying for a loan to begin building a room at the front of the house to extend the dining room and enlarge one of the bedrooms. To carry out this project, she needs to buy cement, reinforcing rods, and sand and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Wassiou

texts.fr:
Wassiou est un homme de 24 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant.
Wassiou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend des produits d’alimentation générale (sac de riz, bidon d’huile, eau minérale, les boite de conserve) dans sa boutique. Au moment, sa difficulté principale c’est les temps de mévente après les fêtes de fin d’année. 
Wassiou a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de riz, de l’huile végétale et des paquets de papier hygiénique. Il veut épargner les profits supplémentaires à WAGES afin d’augmenter à chaque fois le montant de ses emprunts. 
Dans les prochaines années, Wassiou voudrait développer son activité en ouvrant d’autres boutiques dans le centre ville. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’envoyer ses futurs enfants à l’école et au même moment les amener à avoir un engouement pour les micros finances, spécifiquement WAGES.
texts.en:
Wassiou is a 24-year-old man. He is single with no children.

Wassiou has been working as a retail merchant since 2010. He sells grocery products (bags of rice, vegetable oil, mineral water, canned goods) in his shop. At this time, his main difficulty is the slump in sales after the holiday season.

Wassiou requested his first WAGES credit loan to purchase bags of rice, vegetable oil and packages of toilet paper. He wants to set aside his additional profits with WAGES so that he can increase the amount borrowed at the next loan cycle.

In coming years, Wassiou would like to expand his business by opening more shops in the city center. He said that with the profits, he plans to send his future children to school and at the same time get them to develop an interest in micro finance institutions, in particular WAGES.

loans.use: Buy grocery products

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She is 53 years old and lives in Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Rosalyn has been in her business for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to purchase fish to sell to customers at her fish stall.

Rosalyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to expand her fish-selling business in her locality.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Kimly

texts.en: Kimly, 25, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Kimly raises pigs and grows rice, and her husband is a mechanic. Kimly is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Being a father means being responsible to support his family and educate his children. Christopher wants to educate his four children and give them a better future. Aside from farming, he also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. Despite the hardships of life, he has the strong determination to improve their status of living and become successful in the future. 

He planned to improve his hog-raising business but he does not have enough capital, therefore, he is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He believes that, through this loan, he will be able to improve the business as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for hog-raising business

location.town: Bitnong Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.  Ma. Liza has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

Ma. Liza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ma. Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a father of two children ages three and two and lives with his family in their home area in Kitale, Western Kenya. He has been in farming for five years and currently employs one farmhand and produces maize, beans and milk for the local market. He also trades in livestock for additional income.

Isaac has requested Juhudi Kilimo to advance him a loan of 62,400 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the increase in income will go into servicing the loan before he embarks on expanding his farming through his savings. He is optimistic the living standards of his family will also improve.

However, he notes the challenge in feeding animals is quite significant.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adele

texts.fr:
Cliente de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 28 ans. Considérant les difficultés de son foyer pour joindre les deux bouts du mois , Il ya de 29 ans ,elle se lance dans la vente des vivres frais pour venir en aide a  son mari pour élever leurs enfants

Elle a deja bénéficié de plusieurs cycles de prêts, pour ce nouveau, elle va renforcer le stock en s'approvisionnant en vivres frais, tel que cartons de viande de bœuf, cartons de porcs , des queue de bœuf, des cotis de porcs
Tres ambitieuse, elle vend en moyenne 20 a 30 cartons de differents produits, ses benefices lui permettent de soutenir les etudes universitaires de  ses enfants, elle épargne toujours parce qu'elle a pour objectif d'acheter une chambre froide
texts.en:
This client is 49, married, and the mother of four children whose ages vary between 12 and 28. In view of the difficulty her household was having with making ends meet, she began 29 years ago to sell fresh foods in order to help her husband educate their children. 

She has already received several loans, and using this new one, she is going to add to her stock by buying fresh foods such as cartons of beef and pork, oxtails, and pork ribs. 

Very ambitious, she sells 20 to 30 cartons of various products on average. Her profit allows her to pay for the university studies of her children. She always puts aside savings because her goal is to acquire a cold storage facility.

loans.use: to buy cartons of beef and pork, tripe, and ox and pork tails.

loans.name: 040104-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến operates a fishing business. She is requesting a loan to to purchase a fishing net. 

Yến is 32 years old and she is married with 3 children who depend on her. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 040104-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2003, Yến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Yến has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yến has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Yến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Yến hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to buy a cell phone.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 30 year old single man from Sahab Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to pay for materials for his beauty salon such as chairs, hair dryer, perfumes and creams, he wants to increase number of employees. In the future he would like to increase his family income.

loans.use: to pay for materials for his beauty salon

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La familia es originaria migró a Las Piedras, Nayarit hace ya más de 18 años  en busca de un lugar que les permitiera alejarse un poco de la civilización y así poder seguir manteniendo sus tradiciones .
Al llegar a la región de Las Piedras, constituyeron una nueva comunidad Wixarika a la que llamaron “Taimarita” ubicada a 5 kilómetros de Las Piedras sobre la sierra Madre Occidental . Ahí vivieron durante 10 años consecutivos en casa del señor Pablo Taizan de La Cruz quien es padre de Micaela además de compartir con otras familias de sus  hermanos. 
Con el crecimiento de sus hijos y la necesidad de que ellos estudiaran, fue que optaron por salir de la comunidad y buscar una casa de renta en Las Piedras. Al llegar a Las Piedras, les ofrecieron la oportunidad de adquirir un terreno con facilidad de pagos, logrando de esta manera adquirir dicho lote.
Actualmente todos sus hijos estudian y el mayor de ellos está en la universidad en la carrera de Mantenimiento Industrial. Ellos consideran como uno de sus principales propósitos en la vida, darle estudios a todos sus hijos pues consideran que la vida será diferente a como la vivieron ellos.
Aún siguen conservando su cultura y tradiciones y cada fecha que tienen considerada para hacer sus ceremonias, se trasladan hasta la casa de don Pablo Taizan para realizar sus actividades con toda la familia, y así transmitir a sus hijos algo que consideran elemental para sus vidas en este mundo.
 Al tener su propia casa consideran tener algo propio y de esta manera seguir luchando por hacer de su vida algo mejor.
texts.en:
This family migrated to Las Piedras, Nayarit more than 18 years ago, in search of a place that would allow them to distance themselves a bit from civilization while continuing their traditions. Upon arriving at the Las Piedras region, they created a new Wixarika community that they called Taimarita, located 5 kilometers from Las Piedras on the western Sierra Madre. They lived there for 10 consecutive years in the house of Pablo Taizan de la Cruz, who is the father of Micaela. They also shared the house with other families of her siblings.

With the growth of the children and the need for them to start school, they opted to leave the community and look for a house to rent in Las Piedras. Upon arriving in Las Piedras, they were offered the opportunity to acquire a plot of land through scheduled payments. In this manner they were able to acquire the plot. Currently all the children go to school. The oldest is in the university studying industrial maintenance. They believe that one of the primary principles of their life is to provide schooling for their children, as they hope their children's lives will be different than their own.

They still preserve their culture and traditions, and on each date on which they carry out their ceremonies, they travel to the house of Pablo Taizan to carry out the activities with all the family. In this way they pass down to their children something they deem elemental for life in this world. Once they have their own house, they will feel that they have something they own, and in this manner will continue fighting to make something better of their life.

loans.use: to give her children a proper house, where they can develop better opportunities than the one's they've had.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
After being a maid her whole life Beatriz decided to start her own business a year ago. She learned how to make jewelry from a company who sells the materials for the production. Her daughter inspired her to take the course from the company and begin selling the jewelry herself. She now sells to the people in her local community and also to the people in the small town where she grew up.

She is seeking the loan in order to buy more materials and increase production before the Christmas season. This business has allowed Beatriz to be her own boss and provide sufficient income for her livelihood. She has been separated from her husband for 15 years and lives with her daughter.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Materials to make jewelry

loans.name: Piroh

texts.en:
Piroh is a 21 year old girl. Lack of capital funds was one reason she joined MBK. She owns a kiosk that sells snacks and "mambo" ice. She was happy to become an MBK member, because of the lighter and longer loan term they offer. Piroh has only requested a $50 loan because she is still a new member.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her kiosk

loans.name: Gavkhar

texts.en:
Gavhkar has been working at the market for 12 years. Since the beginning she has traded sweets. She receives loans for expansion of her assortment of goods and she uses the profits for her family. There are 12 people living in their house: two of her sons, her husband, her parents–in-law and her brother –in-law. Her elder son has graduated from the agriculture institute and, like his father, works at the local farm. Another son helps her at the market. They have to save money for his wedding and to purchase another house for him. 

It is cold in the winter and very hot in the summer to work in an open-air market. Gavhkar plans to rent a premise for sweets-shop.

loans.use: Open a new store location

loans.name: Gilda Fernando

texts.pt:
Gilda Fernando Novele M. is 30 years old. She was born in Manjacaze on November 13, 1977. She is married with 2 children. Gilda lost her father at an early age, she lived with her aunt and studied until the 4th grade, when her aunt passed away and she returned to live with her mother in 1989. There she started selling bread. She also worked as a maid from1994. In 1999, Gilda married and stopped working as a maid. She saved whatever money she could to buy products which she sold from her backyard in Maxaquene neighborhood in Maputo.

In 2000, Gilda moved to Catembe because she was pregnant with her first child. She then started selling basic products such as tomatoes, sugar and onions in her backyard. Through her church, Gilda found out about Hluvuku. With the loan of 10,000.00MT Gilda plans on buying more products to sell. In the future, she hopes to remodel her small store to be able to sell more and become a successful entrepreneur.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Cliente: Gilda Fernando Novele M. Localização: Bairro Chali- Catembe Actividade: Servicos Valor financiado: 10.000,00MT (400.00US$) Aplicação empréstimo: Venda de comida Início: 02/07/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Gilda Fernando Novele M., 30 anos de idade, nascida em Manjacaze aos 13 de Novembro de 1977, casada com 2 filhos, perdeu o pai muito cedo e foi viver com a tia até aos 11 anos onde frequentou a 4ª classe, só para infelecidade dela esta veio a perder a vida anos mais tarde e teve que retornar a casa da mãe em Maputo em 1989, lá para não ficar sem fazer nada vendia paezinhos. Começou a trabalhar como empregada doméstica em 1994 e recebia pouco valor. Em 1999 veio a casar-se e não deixou de trabalhar como empregada, ela relata que passou momentos difíceis e poupava algum dinheiro para compra de alguns produtos que os vendia no seu quintal onde vivia no bairro de Maxaquene na cidade do Maputo.

No ano de 2000 passou a viver em Catembe e porque estava grávida de seu 1° filho e não mais aguentando fazer trabalhos pesados teve que abdicar do mesmo e é nisto que relançou a ideia de montar uma banca no quintal para venda de tomate, açucar, cebola, etc. Foi através da irmã espiritual da Igreja que teve conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku. Com crédito de 10.000,00MTN pretende comprar produtos diversos para confecionar comida. O trabalho desenvolvido por esta cliente tem impacto positivo na comunidade, póis oferece uma alternativa para compra de comida e diminue as distãncias que as pessoas tinham que percorrrer ,por um lado emprega duas trabalhadoras contribuindo para redução dos índices já elevados de desemprego. A perspectiva futura é conseguir remodelar o seu pequeno estabelecimento e colocar mais produtos para alcançar mais clientes e ser uma empresária de sucesso.

loans.use: To increase stocks of food in her restaurant

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E., who operates a restaurant business, solicits the loan amount $550 to enable her to buy more food items and drinks to boost her restaurant business. She is 62 years old and a widow, mother of 6 children, and she has been a faithful member of LAPO for the past 7 years. She lives in Benin, Edo State in Nigeria and has been in business since 1989.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks and food items

loans.name: Zakonome

texts.fr:
At 44 years of age, Mrs. Zakonome M. lives in Agoè Adjorigba. She is a widow with four (04) children. Her late husband did not leave her much with which to take care of her children. She runs a general food store. Not having any other sources of income, she is constantly faced with stock shortages, a situation which significantly decreases her clientele as well as her income. Worried about the future of her children, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to stock her store and establish a regular clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 44 ans, Madame M. Zakonome, résident à Agoè Adjorigba. Elle est veuve avec quatre (04) enfants. Son défunt mari n’a pas laissé grand-chose pour qu’elle s’occupe de ses enfants. Elle détient une boutique de vente d’alimentation générale. N’ayant pas d’autres sources de revenus, elle est tout le temps confronté à de rupture de stock ce qui fait baisser considérablement sa clientèle ainsi que ses revenus. Soucieuse de l’avenir de ses progénitures, elle sollicite un montant de $1000 pour approvisionne sa boutique et fidéliser sa clientèle.

loans.use: To stock her store with general foodstuffs

loans.name: Basirat

texts.en: O. Basirat is a 35 year old mother of 4 and comes from Mushin in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells plywood. She has been in her business since 1996 and needs the loan to buy more plywood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more plywood for sale

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Verónica is a young mother with a big desire of improvement and self-development. Her only desire is to grant the well-being to her four-year-old loved son who is her only company. She doesn’t have the economic support of anybody, she is a single mother. Everyday she leaves her home very early to do different activities for the sake of her little one. She works half-time delivering letters for a shipping company and when she finishes her shift she sells cheese in the evenings. She brings these delicious cheeses from trips she makes to her home town, Junín. The desire to increase her small business of selling cheeses has lead her to request your help through a loan. Let's make her wish possible so that this hard-working mother keeps on granting the well-being to her beloved little one.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica, es una joven madre con muchos deseos de superación y desarrollo, con el único objetivo de otorgarle bienestar a su querido hijo de cuatro años que es única compañía. Ella no cuenta con el apoyo económico de nadie, es madre soltera y día a día abandona su hogar muy temprano para realizar diversas actividades en beneficio de su pequeño, trabaja como repartidora de cartas en una empresa de correos a medio tiempo y cuando termina su turno por las tardes se dedica a la venta de quesos. Estos deliciosos quesos los trae de los viajes que realiza a su tierra natal, Junín. El deseo de incrementar su pequeño negocio de venta de quesos la llevan a solicitar vuestra ayuda a través de un préstamo. Posibilitemos su petición para que esta trabajadora madre siga otorgándole bienestar a su adorado pequeño.

loans.use: Increase working capital to sell a bigger quantity of cheese.

loans.name: Moulitala

texts.fr:
Specialized in the sewing and emboidering of boubous (wide, flowing traditional robes worn by African men) and all sorts of clothing, El Hadj (a title of respect for someone who has gone on a pilgrimage) A. works primarily for expatriates from neighboring countries, but also has clients from Congo and Cote d'Ivoire. Very ingenious, he is always surrounded by a good aura. He is a father and is the breadwinner for 13 persons. He was born on January 1, 1955. This is his third loan. He is on the far right in the photo; the other people are his workmen.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Spécialisé dans la confection et la broderie de boubous et d’habits de tous genres, EL HADJ A. a pour prinicipaux clients les expatriés des pays voisins mais a aussi des clients au Congo et en Côte -d’Ivoire. Très ingénieux, il bénéficie d’un bon aura dans son entourage. Père de famille, il a 13 personnes à sa charge et est né le 01/01/1955. Il est à son troisième prêt. On le retrouve à l'extrême droite sur la photo, les autres personnes sont ses ouvriers.

loans.use:
Purchase of 8 lengths of Damask cloth

Achat de 8 pièces de tissus bazin

loans.name: Ya Sinnah

texts.en: Ya Sinnah runs a small grocery shop in Makeni town, which she expanded with the loans from SMT.  She plans to increase her stock and, in the future, rent a shop in the market.  She is requesting a loan of $700 to pursue her dreams.  Ya Sinnah is 41 years old and has 9 children.  Her income contributes a lot towards family expenses, especially school requirements.

loans.use: Ya Sinnah has a small grocery store that is experiencing excellent growth and profits.  She needs additional capital to continue to supplement her business as it moves towards becoming sustainable.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Selling food from her cart has become the greatest source of income for Luzmila’s family. A dependable, diligent and dedicated mother, Luzmila has found, through her work, the means to pay for her household needs. In addition to her day-to-day chores, she gets up early in the morning to sell polos and sweatshirts at the San Jose market in Juliaca. At noon she prepares her delicious vegetable stews which she sells to the merchants at the market. With income from these two business activities she is able to cover her household expenses. She would like to add seats, tables and umbrellas to her food cart to make her customers more comfortable. As such, she is turning to you and applying for this loan.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La venta de comida en forma ambulatoria se ha convertido en el ingreso económico más importante de la familia de Doña Luzmila, madre empeñosa diligente y muy dedicada, encontró en este noble oficio la manera de cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.Esta diligente madre adicionalmente a su desempeño diario desde tempranas horas de la mañana se dedica a la venta de polos y polares al por mayor dentro del mercado San José de la ciudad de Juliaca y al medio día prepara sus deliciosos potajes para venderlos a los comerciantes de dicho mercado.Con estas 2 actividades está logrando cubrir satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar, y también ahora desea brindarles comodidad a sus clientes, para ello tiene pensado comprar sillas, mesas y sombrillas, con ese propósito recurre a tu buen corazón y te hace la petición de un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of chairs, tables and umbrellas

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 45 years old and is widow woman with 5 children, ages 2-18 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 2 and 5 years old. Mwajuma is a charcoal seller, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en: Mr. M. Tolibjon lives in the B.Gafurov region. He is divorced and has 2 children. Mr. M. Tolibjon has been engaged in raising livestock since his early years. He learned the first skills when helped his father with taking care of the livestock. The love to animals keeps him in the livestock business as an adult. He has a good flock but dreams of having a large-scale farm. Now, Mr. M. Tolibjon applies to KIVA with the request of a business support loan so that he can purchase one more pedigree bull. In addition to the general livestock business, Mr. M. Tolibjon also has a shoe repair business at home.

loans.use: To purchase one pedigree bull

loans.name: Wafanya Kazi Group

texts.en: These are a group of five who have been together as a group for the past two years. They all sell fresh fish from the ocean in KIgamboni. The men sometime go fishing and do the selling as well. They are all in need of a loan to help the expand there business.

loans.use: To expand business their businesses selling fresh fish.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is a married woman with one 3-year-old child . She began selling clothes in 2007. Every day, she works extremely hard from 9 am to 6 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $175 from her sales.

Happy now seeks a loan in order to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Chidi Ogo

texts.en:
Chidi ogo I. sells cooked foods like rice, beans, plantain, yam, drinks, and juice. She has been in this business for a long time. Chidi wakes up as early as 4:00 am to start the cooking tasks for each day. She loves her business; her customers pay in cash when they come to buy cooked foods, drinks, and juice.

Chidi ogo is 34 years old and is married with 4 children. She is a LAPO client. Chidi ogo lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs a loan amount of $425 to buy more drinks and juice for sale. She says this will go a long way to help her in meeting the demands of her customers. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible

loans.use: To buy more drinks and juice to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señorita Sonia Dávalos, es soltera. El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, en el centro del mercado Nº 4, zona altamente comercial, sobre la Avda. Rodríguez de Francia c/Battilana, inició con un capital de Gs. 1.000.000.- U$ 250.- aproximadamente, que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes y la zona en la que se encuentra es muy poblada y muy concurrida.

La señorita Sonia retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de zapatería como ser: championes, sandalias,calzados para damas y caballeros, especialmente para la temporada primavera - verano. A muy tempranas horas del dia inicia sus actividades aproximadamente a las 06:00 Hs A.M. A fin de comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para su propio futuro salón comercial y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia D. is single. Her business is very well located in the center of the No. 4 market a highly commercial zone above the Rodríguez de Francia c/Battilana avenue. She started her business with approximately $250 in capital. Throughout the years, her business has been expanding as she relies on an expansive list of clients and she is located in a highly populated and busy zone.

Sonia requires this loan to purchase various articles for her shoe shop such as: slippers, sandals, shoes for men and women and especially shoes for the spring-summer seasons. Sonia starts her day very early at 6:00 am so that she can purchase everything she needs for her business.

One of her goals is to be able to expand her business and acquire equipment and furniture to be able to set up her own commercial space so that she can offer a more comfortable and pleasant environment for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sandals, tennis shoes and men and women's shoes.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely inicio hace 4 años con el negocio porque le gusta la belleza y las ventas así que con el fin de apoyara su esposo con el gasto de la casa decidió vender primero como distribuidora independiente, después como sus ventas incrementaban inicio a 4 señoras las cuales también distribuyen los productos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir mas en el negocio para tener mejores oportunidades de venta y aprovecharlas ofertas de la compañía, así como seguir invirtiendo en sus consultoras de venta ya que hay que organizarles juntas y a veces por falta de capital no puede hacerlo.
texts.en:
Aracely started her business 4 years ago because she likes cosmetics and she enjoys sales. She needed to help her husband with the household expenses. She decided to start as an independent distributor and as her sales started improving she hired 4 other ladies to also work as distributors.

She requires a loan in the amount of $400 US, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months. She will invest the funds in the business to create better sales oppotunities and to take advantage of the special offers. She also wishes to keep investing on her hired help, to help keep the business well organized. Sometimes given the lack of capital funds she cannot keep up.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. is a 43-year-old married woman, and she is the mother of two kids. One of her children is in school, while the other child has completed school. Comfort is a distributor and a supplier of ice cream products (e.g., yogurt and ice cream) at a very busy market in Tema, where she lives. She accepts deliveries from dairy manufacturers, and she then supplies retailers with such products. Comfort has been in this business for the past 2 years, during which time she has gained invaluable business experience.

She is now requesting a loan to purchase greater supplies of ice cream products as well as deep freezers so that she can better stock her products. In turn, she believes the loan proceeds will enable her to pay for her child's school expenses.

Comfort belongs to the community group known as the Morning Star Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She notes that she does not sell any goods on group meeting days, and that her picture was taken during her group meeting. She is very grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing additional dairy products and to improve her business by purchasing deep freezers

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun S., 37, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Kampong Cham province. The children both work in a garment factory.  Lun S. runs a small beauty salon in the village to earn a living and is able to make $1.50 a day. Her shop arranges clothes and make-up for brides and grooms. Her husband is a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes $5 a day.

Mrs. Lun S. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase more cosmetic products and clothes for her salon.  (Lun S. is in the picture with her husband and her daughter.)

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products and clothes.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a married mom with one daughter. She lives in Kherson and sells domestic electrical appliances in Dneprovskyi market. Ludmila has her vending location in a very favorable spot which is always busy with customers. She has been running this business for 15 years. Presently, Ludmila has 40,000 Grivnas invested in her business. Her income is 5,000 Grivnas a month.

Ludmila knows how to run her business. She has analytical thinking and can quickly generate solutions in the most challenging situations. Moreover, Ludmila adjusts well to all innovations and uses them to benefit her business. This time Ludmila is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to increase her inventory. She is hoping to repay the current loan in 8 months.

loans.use: increase inventory

loans.name: Binda Edward

texts.en:
Edward was born on 4th April 1944, and he is married to two wives. He has twelve children with his wives. Six of these children are below 15 years of age. He lives in a house that is made up of four rooms and three persons are entitled to a single room.

Edward grew up with very little support from his parents, especially in the area of education. With little education, Edward made his living by doing odd jobs. With these difficulties in life, he decided to join GHAPE.

He enrolled in GHAPE in the year 2007 and he has managed a single loan with no problems with repayment. Edward is requesting a loan of 100,000 FRS with which he is going to buy the following: piglets for 65,000 FRS and garden inputs for 35000 FRS, He will use the profit generated by this loan to continue to educate his children and part will be plowed back into his business. He thinks his business will succeed because he has been doing this business for long period of time.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying piglets and garden inputs

loans.name: Nikel Group

texts.en:
Lucy N. age 30, is married with three children, ages 14, 12 and 9 years. She has a pharmacy business. She started this business in 2007 and works daily from 8am until 9pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 117.

This will be Lucy’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy medicine and repaired the pharmacy shop with a new glass door and has repaid the loan successfully. She hopes for a second loan to open another pharmacy.

Lucy will share this loan with her loan group called Nikel , which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Lucy is 1st on the left in a blue T-shirt.

loans.use: to open another pharmacy

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate Boakyewaa is 57 years old. She is married with five children. She lives at Mampong with her family. Currently all of her children are in school. She is a chemical seller and Kate also sells various kinds of drugs like blood tonic, pain killers, malaria drugs etc. in her neighborhood.  Many local people patronize her drugs as first aid and cure when they are sick. She has been in business for twenty years and the only person who supplies pharmaceutical products in the community. Kate's chemical is registered to operate by Ghana pharmaceutical council.  She wants to use the loan to increase her supplies of drugs to include others that are frequently requested by her customers. Kate hopes to raise good income to take care of her family.  She also hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her children in school. Kate belongs to a village bank called ‘Naomi’.

loans.use: Buy increased supplies of pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Villa Hermosa De Cusi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Villa Hermosa D. Cusi pertenece a un proyecto especial exclusivamente para productores, los socias son D. la comunidad D. Cusi, distrito D. Ocros, Provincia D. Huamanga, La comunidad se ubica al borD. del río Pampas, este río viene a ser el limite con el departamento D. Apurimac.

Las actividades principales D. la comunidad son el cultivo D. frutas como naranja, papaya, palta, mangos, tomate, maíz, además se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores y ganadería. Los productores D. la comunidad D. Cusi veran resultados el resultado se su cocecha en 12 meses, es por ello que pagarán su préstamo en 1 año.

Prudencio es socio del Banco Comunal, es casado, tiene 8 hijos, se inicio con el cultivo D. paltas hace 3 años que es mas rentable, además su esposa tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, su préstamo será invertido en el abonamiento D. los paltos y para la tienda D. su esposa.

Por otro lado Lucila es viuda, tiene 3 hijos que son mayores D. edad, Lucila también tiene 60 paltos en producción, y 50 paltos que recién tienen 2 años, su préstamo invertirá para sus plantaciones.

Los sueños D. los socios es mejorar la producción D. sus paltos y exportar sus productos.
texts.en:
The Hermosa D. Cusi Communal Bank is part of a special project exclusively for producers. The members are from the community of Cusi in the Ocros district of the Huamanga province. The community is located at the edge of the Pampas river which also serves as the border of the state of Apurimac. The main activities of the community are cultivating fruits such as oranges, papayas, avocado, mangos, tomatoes and corn. In addition, they raise small animals and cattle. The producers of Cusi will see the results of their harvest in 12 months and because of this they will repay their loan in one year. Prudencio is a member of the Communal Bank and is married with eight children. He started growing avocados three years ago because it was more profitable and his wife has a grocery shop. He will put his loan towards fertilizing the avocado trees and her husband's shop. Lucila, on the other hand, is a widow with three grown children. She also has 60 producing avocado trees and 50 more that are two years old. Her loan will go towards her plantations. The member's dreams are to improve the yield of their avocado trees and export their products.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Nicoll, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Las Andantes 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo “ Las Andantes 2”  esta representado por la señora Guadalupe e integrada por 13 miembros los cuales se dedican a actividades comerciales como a la venta D. cosméticos, condimentos, ropa y comida entre los varones se dedican al transporte público y a la construcción D. viviendas. Como es común en un amplio mercado siempre existe la competencia D. productos, es por esta razón que los miembros del grupo desean el financiamiento para mejorar la calidad D. sus productos y poder competir con el resto del mercado consiguiendo así un mejor ingreso diario para poder cumplir con sus obligaciones y brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Para una mayoría D. los miembros este es su segundo ciclo demostrando ser capaces D. poder  cumplir con sus obligaciones puntualmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Guadalupe represents the group “ Las Andantes 2.” The group has 13 members who work in a variety of areas like: selling cosmetics, condiments, clothing, and food. The men work in public transportation and home construction. As is common in a large market, there is always a lot of competition among products. This is the reason that the members of the group want a loan. They want to improve the quality of their products and be able to compete with the rest of the market. And in this way get a better daily income so they can meet their obligations and offer their families a better quality of life. For the majority of members, this is the second cycle showing that they are capable of being able to meet their obligations punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Manzooran M. Mustaq Group

texts.en:
Manzooran baji is the wife of M. M. who lives in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its shrines. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. All of her kids are enrolled in a local school located near their house. Her husband operates a cosmetics selling business. He takes orders from the cosmetics shops and buys supplies from the city named Lahore, because Lahore city is famous for its varieties. Manzooran baji herself handles a business sewing clothes. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband and to pay off the school fees for her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy more cosmetics to expand her husband’s cosmetics selling business. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy milk to resell. Riaz baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Najma yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each individual will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee on one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Warren's Group

texts.en:
T. Warren is the leader of Mwino akuwa group in Jinja. He is a married man with four children (1 girl and 3 boys): all the boys are still in school and the girl is too young.

Warren has three businesses: he has rental houses in Jinja town; he has a hardware shop selling building materials; as well as having a kiosk selling cold drinks and snacks. He is so grateful that the loans help him to run and finance his three businesses every four months and with this, he is able to care for his family’s needs and upkeep.

Warren is also the Chairman LC1 for his village and this leadership responsibility helps to bring in much-needed organization and responsibility among its members. He needs a loan to help pay school fees for his children and also to recapitalize his businesses.

loans.use: To pay school fees and recapitalise his businesses

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr:
H. Félix est né vers 1980 à Abogomè dans la Commune de Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Félix réside dans cette Commune depuis son enfance et il y mène comme activité principale la coiffure. Félix a comme activité secondaire l'agriculture.  Félix est père de deux (02) enfants dont un (01) est scolarisé. 

Pour améliorer ses prestations de coiffure dans le but d’accroître ses revenus, Félix a besoin de moyens financiers pour acheter les équipements nécessaires dans son salon de coiffure. C’est la raison pour laquelle Félix sollicite un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Félix was born around 1980 in Abogomè in the township of Akpro Missérété in the Department of the Ouémé. Félix has been living in this township since infancy and he now works here as a hairdresser. Félix has a secondary business: agriculture. He is the father of 2 children, of whom one is enrolled in school.

To improve his services in order to grow his income, Félix needs capital to buy the necessary equipment for his hairdressing salon. This is the reason why Félix is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ramón Castilla”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 34 años, 01 niño que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.

Su impulso  y empeño de ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia, como es una mujer muy esmerada con su trabajo, aprendió a seguir adelante. 
En la actualidad, es muy querida por sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque ella cuenta con todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es ella misma quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal en paquetes para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Marisol, se siente muy joven y con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad de salir adelante como mujer, igualmente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por   iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Marisol belongs to the Ramón Castilla Community Bank and lives in the district of Tarapoto, department of San Martín, Peru. She is 34 years old, lives with her partner and has one son, who goes to school and still depends on her. Her goal is to see her son become successful, and it motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. She runs her store out of her home, and it's a well-conditioned to serve her customers. The earnings she generates helps with the family income. She is very careful with her work and learned how to make headway. Currently, her store is in high demand from a fixed clientele who visits her daily to make their purchases because she has all the products a housewife needs, and she herself tends to the customers with the charisma she is known for. With the loan of 3,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, various brands of canned milk and fish, eggs and personal hygiene products so she can continue providing high-quality service to her customers. Marisol feels very young and strong with her work, and day to day she feels grateful for the great opportunity to make progress as a woman. She also thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for starting on the path of becoming a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general grocery supplies (rice, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin W. sells fish in Bantoma. Godwin has received a senior-high-school education.  He is married and has 6 dependents. His wife is a fishmonger. Godwin has been selling fish since 2001. He is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. His loan will be used to buy fishing net for fishing. He hopes to reinvest the new profits from back into hs business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy fishing net for fishing.

loans.name: Ines Alberto

texts.pt:
Inês Alberto M. nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze província de Gaza (a 300 km da ciddade de Maputo) tem 56 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 1 filha de 22 anos de idade que frenquenta escola. Estudou ate 8 classe tendo parado por falta de visão e questões sociais (os pais tinham o mito de que as mulheres não deviam estudar muito).
Vive com sua família e sustenta também seus pais que se encontram distante, mas na sua responsabilidade.

Inês viajou muito pelo pais desde que saiu do distrito natal de manjacaze. Conhece 4 províncias do pais. Trabalha para o Ministério do Interior a mais de 34 anos como policia. Foi formada no ano de 1974 no centro de formação de policias de Matalane em maputo.
Tem como salário mensal 10.200,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e na construção da sua casa que está fazendo em fases com material convencional.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros Bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de colegas tendo aproximado para solicitar o primeiro credito no valor de13. 000,00MT.
Este é o seu segundo empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 20.000,00MT que prestende comprar materiais de construção da sua casa.

Propõe se pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com o intuito de terminar a obra e posterior compra de mobiliário.
texts.en:
Inês Alberto M. was born in Manjacaze in the Gaza province (300 km from the city of Maputo). She is 56 years old, married, and has a 22 year old daughter who attends school. Inês attended school through the 8th grade. She dropped out due to poor vision and social issues (her parents believed that women shouldn't get much education). She lives with her family and also supports her parents, who although they live far away, are under her care. Inês has traveled a lot throughout the country since she left her native Manjacaze. She has lived in 4 provinces in the country. She has worked as a police officer for the Ministry of the Interior for more than 34 years. She completed her training in 1974 in the Matalane police training center in Maputo. She earns a monthly salary of 10,200,00 MT which she uses to support her family and build her home, a project she is completing in phases with conventional materials. Inês has never had a loan from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends when she approached the bank for her first loan of 13.000,00 MT. This is her second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema. It is for 20.000,000 MT which she will use to purchase construction materials for her home. She plans to pay off the loan without any problems so that she can have access to additional loans to finish her home and furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Germaire

texts.fr: A. Germaire est mariée à HOUNWANOU Agapith, un déclarant en douane. Germaire et Agapith ont 2 enfants, tous scolarisés et âgés respectivement de 7 ans et 5 ans.La famille réside à Sènadé depuis plus de 10 ans ; un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Germaine vend des divers (produits de toilettes et cosmétiques, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les piles, les bougies, etc.) dans sa boutique à côté de sa maison. Germaire s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Germaire a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit à ALIDé; crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour accroître son étalage, Germaire sollicite son deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Germaire is married to Hounwanou Agapith, a customs broker. Germaire and Agapith have two children, aged seven and five, who both attend school. For ten years the family has lived in Sènadé, a popular area in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.
Germaire sells various items (toiletries and cosmetics, milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pasta, batteries, candles, etc.) in her shop next to her house. Germaire gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin’s big international market.
Germaire has already received and repaid a loan from Alidé. In order to expand her selection of products, Germaire is requesting her second loan through Alidé.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy toiletries, cosmetics, pasta, sugar, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Perpetua N. from Mbozi. She is married with three children between the ages of six and thirteen. She is also responsible for supporting two dependents who are orphans. Perpetua owns a small duka (or neighborhood shop) in the city, where she has been selling common household and grocery items since 2003. She works at the business for nine to twelve hours a day, six days a week, assisted by one employee. Perpetua currently earns about $120 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more sugar, rice, salt and other home needs for reselling. In the future, she plans to open the same type of business at a new location. Perpetua thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, salt and other home needs for reselling

loans.name: Bebelinda

texts.en: Bebelinda C. is from the village of Lumipac. She is 46 years old. Bebelinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Bebelinda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Bebelinda has been operating this business for a year now. In 2009, Bebelinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bebelinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Bebelinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be Bebelinda second loan from PMPC. Bebelinda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: Additional stock for grocery store

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret has a business brewing and selling local alcohol. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. 

Margret is 29 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children at higher institutions of learning.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy kola nuts

loans.name: Shar

texts.en:
Shar T. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife works as a technician at the local weather forecasting center, his oldest son operates his own cellphone trading business, and his youngest is a college student. T. operates a mobile grocery and ger wooden parts trading business in his town. 

He works hard to make his business successful, despite having a physical disability which makes operating a mobile business difficult at times. T. went into business in 2000. In 2003, he changed his business and started making felt handicrafts. However, he went back to selling groceries in 2005 after having little success. Since then he has steadily grown his grocery business and currently enjoys a stable operation. 

T. is very hardworking and hopes his future success will enable him to continue to improve his family's quality of life. He hopes to soon rent a stall at a new trading center in his town. He hopes this will be a good location and will allow him to expand his customer base. He says, "Because of my disability I would like to have one selling location for my business." T. is requesting a 363,000 tugrug loan to purchase grocery products for his business and cellphone parts for his son's business.

About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products for his business and cellphone parts for son's business.

loans.name: Cadid

texts.es:
La señora Cadid, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Éxito II”, Distrito D. la Banda D. Shilcayo, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 57 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Cadid, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, alegre y carismática, cualidad que le ayuda bastante en el negocio que maneja. Se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. la línea: Esika  y Avon.

 Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00, comprará productos D. belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices, labiales, esmaltes D. uñas. Parte D. dinero también lo invertirá en la compra D. productos D. gano café y harinas para sus dulces.

Cadid, a su edad es un ejemplo a seguir D. muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cadid belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres con Éxito II" (Women with Success II) in the District la Banda D. Shilcayo, Province San Martín, and the San Martín Department. She is married and is 57 years old. She is the mother of 3 children, all of who are on their own. Cadid is a woman who is very dedicated to her family, happy, and charismatic, a quality that helps a lot in the business she runs. She sells cosmetics from the lines: Esika and Avon. With this loan of S / 1,000.00, she will buy beauty products for her stock, such as perfumes for men, women and children, creams, pressed powders, pencils, lipsticks, and nail polish. She will also invest some of the money in purchasing coffee and flour products for her candy. Cadid, at her age, is a role moD. for many women who start a business and with perseverance achieve their dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business and for helping other women to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señorita Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes.
Virginia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela R. que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar harina, azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia e instalar ahí su tienda de abarrotes.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Miss Virginia has been a member of the “Great Power” Community Bank for the past three years. She is from the Llave district, in the El Collao province, in the department of Puno. She is 23 years old, is single and doesn’t have any children. She has completed secondary school. She buys and sells groceries. Virginia told us that with her first loan from the “Manuela R.” Movement, which was for 300.00 new soles, she was able to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 1,200.00 new soles with which she will buy flour, sugar, rice, milk, noodles, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own house. In this house she will be able to have her grocery store. What she likes most about the community bank is the savings and that the members arrive at the meetings on time.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy flour, sugar, rice, milk, noodles.

loans.name: Estefita

texts.es: Estefita tiene 34 años, quienes conviven con ella en su propia casa es su pareja que se dedica al transportes de pasajeros, y sus 02 hijos, gemelos ellos y tienen apenas 03 años de edad. Desde hace 9 años que se dedica a la venta de pescado, además de plátanos en un pequeño puesto que mandó construir, ubicado en el interior del mercado de su zona. Para Estefita su trabajo le da mucha satisfacción ya que le permite relacionarse con sus clientes y amigos, por ser una mujer muy jovial en atender, eso le da más ventaja en sus ventas. Este negocio le resulta rentable, puesto que las ventas son rápidas como el pan caliente, siendo dos factores que ayudan a su progreso como la ubicación de su puesto así como por ser la única que vende este rubro. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy cumplido con el pago de sus cuotas. Además considera que le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal ya que todos los integrantes son muy comunicativos y puntuales. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más pescados y plátanos, así como también invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como madera y calaminas para renovar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Estefita is 34 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband, who works transporting passengers, and the couple's two sons, 3 year old twins. Estefita has worked selling fish since she was 9 years old. She also sells bananas in the small stand that she had built inside the market in her neighborhood. Her work brings her great satisfaction, since it allows her, as a personable woman, to build relationships with her clients and other friends. Those relationships and her outgoing personality are the advantages that bring her sales. Her business is profitable, given that her products "go as quickly as hot bread.".Another factor that has contributed to her success are the location of her stand, apart from other merchants selling the same products. This is Estefita's third loan with MFP. She commits to be very responsible with the timeliness of her payments. She likes working with the other members of her Community Bank, since all of the members are communicative, and punctual with their payments. With the loan that she is requesting, Estefit will buy more fish and bananas, and will also invest in construction materials to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fish and bananas, and improve her home.

loans.name: Saboro Group

texts.en: This is Saboro Jan group.  The group leader is Sema Jan. She is married with four children, who all go to school. she is a hard working man and she works in order to support both her husband and her childern.She is a baker and she is much popular in her area for this business. Most of her neighbors come to her and bring their dough for baking. She has been involved in this busienss more than 10 years. Sema wants to take out a loan for her bakery business which is in her house. She wants to purchase more ingredients like, flour and fire wood to expand her bakery.She hopes to have a small shop for this business and to support her childern to go to school and have a bright future.She is a successful business woman and would like to be the best.

loans.use: buying flour and fire wood

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es socio del Banco Comunal de Ladrilleros de Compañía, es de la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Carlos es conviviente y tiene 28 años, Carlos se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, producto que vende crudo en el mismo lugar.
Carlos necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra y pago de peón.
Los sueños de Carlos son tener capital propio y una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Carlos is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañía Communal Bank in the Comañía community, which is 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Carlos is 28, in a common law marriage. Carlos makes bricks by hand in the Compañía community. He sells his product unprocessed in the same place. Carlos needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy land a pay a worker. Carlos’s dreams are to have his own capital and a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land a pay a worker

loans.name: Mpara Hiv/aids Support Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: Robert K. (pictured at top left and also in the group photo) is the leader of this lending group in Kyenjojo. He is 44 years old and married with 8 children aged 4-22 years old, including 4 orphaned dependents. Robert is a hard-working businessman who sells produce in Rugando Musanju .  Although he works hard, his income from the business is low, though he is able to  pay his children’s school fees. He buys produce from farmers in the villages and sells it at the market. Robert needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale.

loans.name: Delfa's Group

texts.en: Delfa T. is from the village of Mohon Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Delfa is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults. Delfa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Delfa operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Delfa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,800 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Delfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delfa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Delfa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Doru

texts.en:
Doru S. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing materials like yeasts etc.  Doru is 42 years old and is married to a policeman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more brewing materials like yeasts etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Rotsie

texts.en:
Rotsie C. is from the village of Macanhan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 25 years old. Rotsie is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Rotsie owns & operates a buying and selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling agricultural crops like copra and bananas in the  city. Rotsie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rotsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rotsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Rotsie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more copra and bananas to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rotsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Martha Aurora

texts.es:
Martha Aurora Q. M.  tiene 29 años, es casada,  tiene  3 hijos que se llaman Roxana de 9 años, Jairo de 6 años y Paúl de 3 años.  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una  a una distancia de hora y media del  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
Ella es socia miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.
Martha trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como  fuente principal económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son el maíz, papas, habas, trigo, arbeja.   Vende los productos en el cantón de San Miguel. 
Martha solicita el crédito para comprar químicos, fertilizantes.  Su meta es  que su producción se mejore para poder obtener buenos precios al momento de la venta.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son el cambio de clima, sequía ya que debido a estos fenómenos se puede perder la cosecha. Martha manifiesta que antes realizó un crédito y utilizo en la agricultura,  manifiesta que en su comunidad celebran a San Francisco y  los domingos sale a la feria a San Pablo, con su familia.
texts.en:
Martha Aurora Q. M. is 29 years old and married with 3 children: Roxana who is 9, Jairo who is 6, and Paul who is 3. They live in the San Francisco de Rumi Pamba precincts about an hour and a half from Canton San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar. She is a member of the San Francisco de Rumi Pamba village bank made up of 25 members, most of whom work in agriculture. Martha has worked in agriculture her whole life and this forms the basis for supporting her family. The primary crops grown in the area are corn, potatoes, beans, wheat, and peas. She sells the crops on the street of San Miguel. Martha is seeking a loan to buy some chemicals and fertilizers. Her goal is to improve her production to sell at better prices and increase her sales. She faces various obstacles such as climate change and drought since such phenomena can mean a total loss of the harvest. Martha has received one other loan which she also used for agriculture. In her community, they celebrate the holidays of San Francisco and San Pablo which she enjoys with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza P. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Analiza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Analiza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta A. sells cooked rice with tomatoes and fried chicken at Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Alberta has received junior high education. Her husband is a businessman. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice and frozen chicken for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy bags of rice and frozen chicken for sale

loans.name: Angele

texts.fr: Angèle B. est une femme de 23 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Tambacounda dont elle fait parti du Comité de Gestion depuis le début en 2008. Elle développe un petit commerce de jus de citron, d'huile de palme et de fruits de mère telles les crevettes. Son prêt lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises (huile de palme, jus de citron et crevettes). Son objectif est de prendre ses besoins personnels en charge, de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Angèle B. is a 23-year old woman, married and the mother of three dhicldren. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of the association of Catholic Women of Tambacounda and a member of its Management Committee since the Banc’s inception in 2008. Her line of business is selling lemon juice, palm oil and seafood, for example, shrimp. Her loan will allow her to increase her stock of goods (palm oil, lemon juice and shrimp). Her goal is to take care of her personal needs and to support her husband in providing for the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening and promoting her business

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao S., 32, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. She sells fish and earns USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, who also earns USD 5 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Sakponou

texts.fr: F. est marié et père de 3 enfants, il est vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille il s'est lancé dans le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. il s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de lomé. son stock de marchandises est en baisse, il voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 3 cartons de savons, 6 cartons de pâte alimentaires, 3 cartons de détergents, 7 cartons de boites de conserves et divers.
texts.en:
Mr. F. is married and the father of three children. He lives with his family in the Adidogomé neighborhood, which is on the outskirts of the city of Lomé.
