To meet his family's needs, he has started a grocery business. He obtains his supplies in Lomé's local markets. As his supply is getting low, he would like to re-stock and is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 3 cartons of soap, 6 cartons of pasta, 3 cartons of detergent, 7 boxes of canned food, and more.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general grocery products

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 37 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Jucuapa, departamento de Usulután, es padre soltero tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad el cual depende económicamente del trabajo de Oscar, el negocio es  venta de CD, DVD.
El negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante por las calles de mayor comercio de Gotera, no tiene horario fijo, trabaja todos los días de la semana, el necesita un préstamo para compra de mercadería para continuar con el negocio, compra de CD y DVD. El riesgo que corre es que los precios de los productos bajen.
Las aspiraciones de Oscar son apoyar a su hijo con los estudios, ya que el no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar, trabajar para darle mejores condiciones de vida a pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old. He lives in the town of Jucuapa, in the Usulután district. He is the single father of a 10-year-old son, who depends economically on Oscar's work. Oscar's business is selling CDs and DVDs. He carries out his business as a walking vendor in the shopping districts of Gotera. He does not have a fixed schedule, but he works every day of the week. He needs a loan to buy merchandise, CDs and DVDs, to continue his business. He takes the risk that prices of these products will go down. Oscar's hopes are to support his son with his studies, since he himself was not given the opportunity to go to school, and to work to give better living conditions to his little son.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (CDs and DVDs)

loans.name: Emérita Yovanela

texts.es: La  Sra. Emérita Yovanela R. C.  ella  es trabajadora del colegio público “CERMA” desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria , tiene  veinte ocho  años de desempeñarse como Docente, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  seis  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de el y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emérita Yovanela R. C. has been a teacher for 28 years; she’s currently employed as a primary school teacher at “CERMA” public school. She’s married. She has had six loans with CEPRODEL that she’s used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit to her in that they have helped to improve her and her family’s living conditions. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For zinc metal sheeting, sand and cement.

loans.name: Belleza

texts.en:
This is Belleza D., 55, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Zalde, a driver, and mother to their own little angel. By the grace of God, Belleza has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually send her child all the way through college.

Belleza oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. Tricycles are motorcycles with sidecars, capable of carrying at least five passengers. Due to their compact size, tricycles are favorites when travelling through the small, traffic congested streets of the communities. Income is generated either through direct earning (if the partner or the husband of the partner is the one operating the tricycle) or through payment of boundary (daily quotas, if partner lets other people drive the tricycle and they have to pay a set price, more or less like rent for the tricycle. Any excess beyond the quota will be earnings of the person who rented the tricycle). 

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy accessories and spare parts for the tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Belleza dreams of being able to have another business soon, preferably her own variety store. She also dreams that her child will have a quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy accessories and spare parts for the tricycle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence U. is from the village of Kilon-ac, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies like banana cues in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florence joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Awatif

texts.en: Awatif L. is currently in the business of selling clothes  and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell.  Awatif is 45 years old and is widowed.   She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Don Jose Antonio H. P. es trabajador del Centro de salud,  El Realejo se desempeña como Tecnico de Malaria Tiene ya 19 años de laborar bpara el Minsa .
Don Jose Antonio lleva ya 05 creditos con CEPRODEL con los cuales ha logrado ir reparando su vivienda poco a poco y brindarle una major forma de vida a su familia, esta vez solicito credito para reparar su cocina ya que con las aguas de los ultimos dias se le daño, es un cliente  muy responsable y cumplido con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio H. P. is an employee at the El Realejo Medical Center.  He is a Malaria Technician, and has been working for the Ministry of Health for 19 years.  

Jose Antonio has had 5 loans with CEPRODEL, with which he has managed to make improvements to his home little by little, and provide a higher standard of living for his family.  This time, he requested a loan to repair his kitchen, which was damaged by the rains of the past few days.  He is a very responsible client, who is punctual with his payments.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies (zinc, lumber, nails).

loans.name: Janeth Magaly

texts.es:
Janeth Magaly  C. C. tiene 39 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con el compañero y con el hijo,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Janeth se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para sembrar cacao.
Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Janeth Magaly C. C. is 39 years old she lives in a common law marriage with her partner and child. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Janeth is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 5 years. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets of the same city.

Janeth needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn crops. The loan will help her to meet her financial needs. Some problems that she faces are plagues and disease and climate change. Janeth’s dream is to buy land to grow cocoa.

She enjoys cooking.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ónix

texts.es:
Ónix L. R., tiene la edad de 39 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos que es su mayor prioridad. El quiere abastecer de mayor mercadería su local y así tener una más amplia gama de productos para sus clientes. El tiene varios años que se ha dedico a esto, cuenta con mucha experiencia y le va bien  en su negocio por lo cual quiere aumentar su mercadería y generar mayores ventas para su bienestar familiar y el de su negocio,  el  también piensa en el futuro de sus hijos y quiere  poderles dar estudios para que en un futuro sean unos buenos profesionales en alguna área especifica.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja que los otros lugares de financiamiento.
texts.en:
Ónix L. R. is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are his biggest priority. He wants to stock his business with more merchandise so that he has a wider range of products for his customers. He has been in this business for several years and he has a lot of experience. His business is going well which is why he wants to increase his merchandise and generate more sales for his family and his business’ well-being. He is also thinking of his children’s future and wants to be able to provide them with schooling so that they will be good professionals in a specific area.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans in public banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with greater facilities and the interest rate is much lower than other loan institutions.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Monica Angelica

texts.es: La señora Mónica se dedica a la venta de comida ya hace bastante tiempo, también trabaja como cocinera y limpieza en una institución no le pagan mucho es por eso que ella vende comida solo los  días de feria ya que esos dias tiene mucha venta, y mucha clientela por los deliciosos platos que prepara, es muy conocida por su buen sazón, con el trabajo de ella y su esposo sobrellevaron a su familia día a día,  su esposo se dedica a la cerrajería. La señora Mónica le ayuda cuando tiene bastante trabajo, La señora saco el crédito para comprar ollas, amoladora, para  mejorar el negocio de su  esposo, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mónica has been selling food for a long time. She also works as a cook and janitor at an institution. They don’t pay her much, so that is why she sells food on market days. Those are the days when sales are best and she has a lot of customers because of the delicious foods that she prepares. She is well-known for her good cooking.

With her job and her husband’s, they take care of the family from day to day. Her husband is a locksmith. Mónica helps him when he has a lot of work. 

She is taking out the loan to buy cooking pots, and also a grinder to improve her husband’s business. She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has provided her.

loans.use: To buy cooking pots, a grinder, a drill, an other items

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de M.R.A.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, algunas van a empezar a emprender actividades independientes con el crédito obtenido por la Fundación Paraguaya.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 

La Señora Erika es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la compra y ventas de Ropas, también tiene una librería donde tiene minicarga, ventas de golosinas.
Todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 1  hijo y su marido quien trabaja  como Albañil. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora Erika solicita el crédito para la compra de más Ropas y ampliar su librería.
texts.en:
“La Esperanza” (The Hope) Communal Bank was formed by bringing together various neighbors of M.R.A. City.  All the bank's members carry out their activities independently; for example, sales and preparing fast food. Some will begin carrying out independent activities with this loan obtained through the Fundacion Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation).  The members have formed a very united group, capable of realizing together activities that strengthen their collegiality.

Erika is one of the bank's members. She is dedicated to buying and selling clothing, and also has a book store where she sells small items, including sweets. All her customers admire her efforts. Erika has a very united family with 1 child and a husband, who works as a bricklayer.

Erika is very satisfied with her activity and the training they receive as a group. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to sell, and to expand her book store.

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHING, T-SHIRTS, SHORTS, AND OTHER ITEMS TO SELL

loans.name: George Mwachala

texts.en:
George Mwachala K. is a 36 year old man. He is married to Janet and together they have four children. George has been in the transport as a primary business for the last two years. Besides transport business, he also manages a clothes material shop which is runned by the wife most of time. 

He was introduced to KADET by a friend and this is his first loan from KADET, and he plans to purchase clothing materials for sale with aim to boost the clothing material business.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his cloth business. His dreams and hopes are to succeed through KADET.

loans.use: purchase materials into his cloth business

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
El Senor Jose Francisco E., es habitante de Jumali, del Municipio de Pueblo Nuevo, en Esteli, casado, de 50 anos de edad, con 4 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura.
Desde muy corta Edad Don Jose tuvo que dedicarse por tiempo completo a ayudar a sus padres en las actividades de la siembra, por lo que le impidio completamente a estudiar, a penas logro terminar el primer grado de primaria.
Cuando se independizo, realizo una sociedad con un agricultor de su comunidad, durante 8 anos y actualmente es independiente.
El se dedica principalmente a la siembra de hortalizas, pero tambien en temporadas, siembra granos basicos, acomodandose con el terreno que cuenta.
Realizo este prestamo para la siembra de 1/2 manzana de Tomate, sobre todo lo quiere para la compra de Insumos varios. Don Jose esta muy optimista de obtener buenos resultados de esta cosecha y muy contento de poder ayudar a ootras personas con fuete de empleo.
Su meta es seguir mejorando su nivel de vida poco a poco, pero sobre todo recoger dinero para poder operar a su hijo (14 anos de edad), que tiene problemas en el corazon.
texts.en:
Señor Jose Francisco E. lives in Jumali, in the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo in Esteli. He is married, 50 years old, has four children and works in agriculture. For a long time, Don Jose has had to devote all his time to helping his parents with planting and because of this, he was unable to focus on school and barely managed to finish first grade. 

When he moved away from home, he started an agricultural community and is now  independent. He primarily sells vegetable seeds but also sells basic grains when they are in season, depending on the location. This loan will be used for the seeds of .9 acres of tomatoes. Above all what he wants is to buy various raw materials. Don Jose is very optimistic about achieving good results with this harvest and is very happy to be able to help other people with a source of employment. 

His goal is to continue improving his quality of life little by little, but above all to be able to earn enough money to be able to pay for his 14-year-old son's heart operation.

loans.use: To plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo A. T., està muy agradecido con su credikiva pues ha mejorado su infraestructura de negocio e incrementado el volumen de ventas de sus productos. En la actualidad està aplicando a un subsidio de vivienda para obtener su casa en Villas de San Pablo, macroproyecto liderado por la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo en su misiòn como constructora de comunidades. Este es su segundo credikiva  y el dècimò credito que recibe por parte de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, para inyectarle un nuevo capital de trabajo a su negocio con el cual comprarà insumos para la preparaciònde alimentos vegetarianos empacados como Cebada, ajonjolí, linaza, harina integral  y empaques. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Gustavo por favor ingrese al siguiente enlace:
 http://www.kiva.org/lend/189014
texts.en:
Gustavo A. T. is extremely grateful for his previous Kiva loan since it helped improve the infrastructure of his business and increase the sales volume of his products.  He is currently applying for a housing subsidy in order to obtain a home in Villas de San Pablo.  Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo is a leader of this large project in order to fulfill its mission as a builder of communities.  

This is Gustavo’s second Kiva loan and the tenth one he has received from Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo.  The new injection of operating capital will be used to buy ingredients for preparing vegetarian snacks such as barley, sesame, linseed, and whole grain flour, as well as packaging.  To learn more about Gustavo’s story, please click on the following link:  http://www.kiva.org/lend/189014

loans.use: Purchase packaging & ingredients for making vegetarian snacks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to continue building a wall in front of his house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is currently in a business of selling charcoal. She is 50 years old. Mary is a widow with four children, all of whom go to school. 

Mary borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  G. est une femme  divorcée de 58 ans. Elle a en charge 2 enfants. Elle est commerçante  depuis plus de 10 ans et vend des marchandises diverses. Elle ne compte sur personne pour satisfaire ses besoins personnels, ce qui explique le choix de cette  activité génératrice de revenus.  Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis mai 2002. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs destiné à acheter des tissus, produits de beauté et autres produits divers dans le but de diversifier son activité de vente de glace. Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de payer la scolarité de sa fille et de renforcer son épargne ce qui l’aidera  à gérer les imprévus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou G., age 58, is divorced and has two children to support. She's been a merchant for more than ten years, and sells various products. She counts on no one else to provide for herself, which explains why she choose this trade.

She's been a member of the Yoff bank since 2002. She's seeking a loan of XOF 150'000 to buy fabrics, beauty products, and other various items, in order to diversify her current business (selling ice). Her profits enable her to pay her daughter's school expenses and bolster her savings, which will help her manage unexpected events.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and beauty products

loans.name: Phim's Group

texts.en:
Four low-income people have decided to seek a loan for similar purposes. One of these people, Phim M., 31, has been chosen to be the leader of this loan group by the other members. 

Phim M. and her husband currently catch fresh fish in and around Tunle Sap River, and they always sell all fish at retail, so that they will get a proper price. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are young and attend school. Currently, the old machine the family uses to connect with the boat has broken down and this has been affecting their income. Phim M. will use this loan to buy a new machine to replace the broken one. She is the head of the four-member group. 

Mrs. K., Mrs. N., and Mrs. T. are earning a profit by fishing; all of these women will use their loans to buy nets for their fishing activities.

loans.use: to buy a new machine to replace a broken one.

loans.name: Cuahutemoc

texts.es:
El señor Cuahutemoc es una persona muy responsable y bien trabajador, para el siempre esta primero el bienestar de la familia. Hace tiempo el compro el terreno donde actualmente vive; que con propios ahorros formo lo que ahora es su patrimonio.
 En este momento se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para pagar las escrituras de su vivienda, de tal manera tendrá todos en orden para un futuro que sus documentos en regla para que en un futuro no tenga problemas legales.
texts.en:
Cuauhtémoc is a very responsible, hard working person.  For him, his family’s wellbeing always comes first.

Some time ago he bought the property where he currently lives and with his own savings formed what is now his patrimony.  

He needs a loan to pay the fees associated with legalizing the deed to his house in order to have everything in good order so that there won’t be any legal problems in the future.

loans.use: to pay deed registration fees for his house.

loans.name: Silvia Teresa

texts.es:
Silvia tiene su propio negocio la venta de ropa y cosméticos, con más de cuatro años de experiencia, siendo su oficio costurera, pero por motivo de ganar un poco más, comienza  a vender cosméticos,  lo que se ha ayudado mucho, y que gracias a los financiamiento de Afodenic, ha comprado mas cosméticos, ropa, zapatos,  así como mejoras a su pequeña casa.
El objetivo de Silvia es la mejora a su vivienda, que ha venido mejorando poco debido a otros gastos de familia, ya ahora tiene un bebe de 18 meses de nacido y requiere más cuidado.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo será para el cambio de techo, el marco es de cuartones de madera, ahora pondrá perlines que es más seguro, laminas de zinc nuevo, golosos entre otros para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Silvia has her own business selling clothing and cosmetics and she has more than four years' experience. She is a seamstress by trade but with the objective to earn a little more money she started to sell cosmetics and it has helped her very much. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) she has purchase more cosmetics, clothing, and shoes, and she has also made some improvements to her small house.

Silvia's objective is to improve her home. She has been doing few improvements because of other family expenses. She now has an 18 month old baby and he needs more care. 

With this new loan she will replace the roofing. The frame is made of wood and now she will be able to use steel, which is safer. She will purchase new zinc sheets and she will cover the labor expenses to start the project.

loans.use: to purchase materials to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with five children. 

Eva has a retail shop that sells beauty products, perfumes, t-shirts & blouses from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional stocks from NATASHA & AVON.

Eva is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Lonidah

texts.en:
Lonidah is 54 years, married to David and supports a family of seven. She has been running a farming business for the last 18 years, with a monthly income of KES 3,000. 

With her first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET, she plans to purchase wheat seeds and top dress fertilizers for her farm. This will enable her to buy farm inputs and increase her income.

In the future, she intends to buy more farming land and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tiessiri Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Tièssiri II sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AMINATA MOUSSA, qui est debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir environs 0,8  hectares de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of group Tièssiri II are married women who are on average 43 years old with three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Baba, one of the villages of Massigui Township is Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).
They are partnering with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. They cultivate rice and groundnuts among other crops. They are on their fifth collaboration with the organization.
With this new loan, Aminata Moussa - who is standing in the middle in the picture - plans on buying agricultural inputs and small equipement. She will also pay for plowing costs to maintain about 1.9 acres of rice and groundnuts.
After the harvest, productions are sold in the town of Massigui to a clientele comprising men and women. Aminata expects an average profit of about 80,000 CFA at the end of the agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs, seeds, fertilizer and small equipment.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 46 years old and has been in mixed farming for the last 25 years. He produces coffee, eggs, tea, and milk. He is married with three children between 14 and 4 years old. He has employed one farmhand on his farm.

Simon has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to expand his poultry unit and purchase more poultry birds. He says the increased income will enable him to educate his children. This is Simon's second loan request. Fluctuation in market prices is the major challenge in Simon's farming business. He, however, remains very optimistic that his Juhudi loan will have a positive impact.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and construct a poultry unit

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 36-year-old married man with four children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to own rental houses in Fort Portal town. He sells used shoes and has been in this business for two years. His major setback is the ever-rising prices of products. His dream is to import shoes himself. Paul needs the loan to buy second hand shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy second hand shoes to sell

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es: La señora Josefa, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella trabaja con la Avon de Nicaragua, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual empezó una vez que llego a comprar a Avon y en la visita le propusieron transformarse en promotora de ventas y decidió empezar el negocio, este negocio es aparte de su trabajo como docente. es por eso que solicita el credito para la compra de lapiz labial, cremas, pintura de labios, pinturas de uñas, polvos y perfumes. Doña Margarita tiene 66 años tiene su negocio que es la venta de artículos varios ya que posee una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Su mayor desafío ha sido que las ventas se han disminuido, pero lucha para que el negocio sea rentable cada día.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefa sells cosmetics. She works with Avon of Nicaragua and has been in business for six years. Josefa started her business when she started buying Avon products and came up with the idea of become a sales representative. She manages her business part-time since she also has a job as a teacher. Josefa is requesting a loan to buy lip pencils, crèmes, lipsticks, nail polishes, powders, and perfumes.

Doña Margarita is 66 years old and has a business selling various products from a store in her home. Her greatest challenge is dealing with diminished sales, but she strives to make her business profitable each day.

loans.use: to buy lip pencils, crèmes, lipsticks, nail polishes, powders, and perfumes.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 43 years old and lives in Zamora, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Meriam has a business selling different kinds of viands. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Meriam has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her viand vending.

Meriam has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her viand vending

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 23 years old and an enterprising business man.  He is single but helps his siblings and his parents.  He has been a cobbler for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 6,600 which he uses for his basic needs.

He is applying for his sixth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully.  Patrick will use the loan to buy leather material for making shoes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his siblings.  His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shoe shop which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy leather material for making shoes.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Loreta has a retail shop that sells umbrellas, bed sheets & clothing.  Her husband is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy umbrellas & bed sheets for sale.
Loreta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Loreta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy umbrellas & bed sheets for sale

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan, Isabela.  She is 41 years old, married with four children.  Nora has managed her retail store for many years.

According to Nora, the income generated from her business enables her to give daily allowances to her school-age children.

Now, she is requesting a loan P15,000 (Philippine pesos) to purchase additional stock, such as various snacks, canned goods and noodles to sell in the local community.  She hopes that she can get the loan she requested, to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as various snacks, canned goods and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 44 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has 4 children.  Helen works in the fishing industry and resells as well as catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years.  

Helen has requested loan for PHP 3000 to purchase more fish to sell.  Helen has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Esperanza De Pucarani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA DE PUCARANI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por once integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Irma.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción, servicios y comercio.
 
La señora Irma indica que es la primera ves que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de dulces que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces) que compra de la Ceja y posteriormente  lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza de Pucarani” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 11 members led by a governing board headed by Irma.  The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have production, services and commerce.

Irma indicates that this is the first time she’s joined a Pro Mujer communal bank having joined thanks to an invitation from one of her girlfriends.  She currently has a candy store that she’s had for several years now.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy candy in La Ceja to then resell in her store.  This way of working allows her to generate income to help her family since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy candy.

loans.name: Rong

texts.en:
Rong (in the photo), 56, is a weaver and she also buys additional finished silk and cotton products from other weavers in her village to sell. Her husband, Chhom, 66, is a security guard. The couple has been married since 1979 and has four children - three sons and one daughter. Three are married and live outside the family home and the other one has full-time employment. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Rong is asking for a loan of $600 to add to her own money to buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.use: to add to her own money to buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Aasia's Group

texts.en:
Aasia is 27 years old, married, and has a 3-year-old daughter.

Her husband is a daily wage laborer and she supports him by doing decorative embroidery. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business improvement. With the loan she will buy embroidery material in bulk quantity such as beads, threads and embroidery frames that will allow her to make better looking embroidered clothes and increase her profits.

She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that a loan investment will help her to improve her business further as well as her profits.

She is a new loan applicant and very confident about her future success as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy beads, embroidery frames, thread, etc..

loans.name: Narom

texts.en:
Narom (in the photo), age 30, is single. She lives with her widowed mother in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Narom is a garment worker. She is asking for a loan in the mount of $1,000 to build a kitchen where she can cook because the old one was broken.

loans.use: to build a kitchen where she can cook.

loans.name: Blesyl

texts.en:
Blesyl is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.  Blesyl has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Blesyl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Blesyl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: 03.1.85 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nâng operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Nâng is 58 years old and she is married with four children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 85 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. Nâng lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nâng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Nâng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nâng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Saffa Philip's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers in a primary school in the city of Kenema. This school was founded in 2002 by a charitable organization to improve education in the community. Teachers of this primary school have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan.

Philip is the leader of the group. Philip is age 54. He was born in a place called Massayiema in Eastern Sierra Leone. Philip is married and has four children. He has been in the teaching profession for 33 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, bags of cement, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, bags of cement, nails, etc. for the construction of a house

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 34-year-old married woman. She has four children and all of them are in school. For the past three years, she has had a business in Bor, South Sudan, selling charcoal. 

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ketty Maribel

texts.es:
Ketty es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Ketty pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ketty trabaja brindando clases particulares a niños, ella cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su vivienda en el dicta sus clases de reforzamiento, ella puede trabajar por un aproximado de 6 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su paciencia y por el trato amable que brinda a sus alumnos.
Ketty se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder brindar de manera didáctica una mejor enseñanza para sus alumnos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder trabajar en un centro educativo de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Ketty is a 22 year old woman.  She’s single and lives in with her parents and brothers in Ica, within the Parcona district.  She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to succeed.  Thanks to her efforts and help from her family she was able to study education.  She likes to dance in her spare time and on occasion cook some delicious “Tallarines Rojos” to share with her family.

With great effort and dedication, Ketty works as a tutor for children.  She has a small space in her home where she gives refreshment classes and where she can work about six hours daily.  She feels that things are going well for her because she treats her students so well.

Ketty is grateful to Kiva for the loans which have allowed her to buy a computer, which helps her very much to teach classes in a better manner.  She will be able to keep working toward her great dream of working at an education center in the city.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. a 30 years old started her foodstuffs business 8 years ago. She joined LAPO two years after she started her business with her little saving. According to her LAPO came to rescue her when her business was at the point of collapsing as a result of inadequate running capital. She is eager to get the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jacinta would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tey

texts.en:
Tey S. V. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and his child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  He makes his living by operating a tuk tuk (a passenger taxi cart attached to a motor bike) and typically makes around $4/day. His wife (pictured here because V. is unavailable), meanwhile, runs a business at home selling duck eggs, roast beef, chickens, local wine, and other grocery products. She normally earns about $25/day in revenue. Their child attends school and usually helps to sell at home when she finishes class. In order to help finance his household, Tey has asked for a loan to purchase another tuk tuk such that he may generate more income.
Additionally, Tey and his wife are eager to one day expand the amount of grocery items sold at their stand.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk tuk to run his business

loans.name: Haja Furan

texts.en:
Haja Furan K. is forty years old, married with five children. She is a subsistence farmer in Kurumaslaiya village outside of Kabala in Northern Sierra Leone. Haja has been farming for nearly twenty years. She grows cabbage, hot peppers, peanuts and some rice but is not able to grow enough to earn sufficient income for the family because the work is very labour-intensive.

Haja and other village women have organized themselves into farmers' groups and have started a savings club. Their aim is to increase their farming products to improve their income. Haja is therefore personally requesting a loan of $175 so that she can hire seasonal labourers and purchase seeds.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and hire seasonal labor

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en: Yelena H. lives in Gahramanli Village. It is a small city in the Beylagan Region, which sits in southwest Azerbaijan. She is married and has 3 children. Her business is cattle-breeding. She has 5 years experience in this business. She wants to buy a cow, but does not have enough money. Therefore, she applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan. Yelena wants to borrow $300 and use the loan to buy a calf.

loans.use: To Buy a Calf

loans.name: Abdel Amir

texts.en: Abdel Amir lives with his wife and 3 children in Nabatieh, in south Lebanon. He is a 40 year old man striving to provide for his family. He has two jobs. Mohamad is the driver of a pick up truck. He transports construction material and is also an itinerant coffee salesman; he wanders around selling hot coffee to the people he crosses on the road. Abdel Amir is doing his best to support and take care of his family. He needs a loan to help him pay his children's tuition fees since he wants to offer them the best possible education.

loans.use: To pay his children's tuition fees

loans.name: Lawrencia

texts.en: Lawrencia E. is a 51 year old widow with 9 children. She comes from Igbenerin in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She began her business in 2005 and requests a loan to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna K., age 41, has been married since 1985 and has four children, two sons and two daughters. She is currently in business buying mango and sapodilla from villagers and reselling them in the market. She has been in this business since 2005. In addition, she also buys and resells pork. Her husband has been a construction worker since 2000. Her four children are living under her custody. Her two sons are working as construction workers with her husband, and one daughter is working at a garment factory. The youngest daughter is attending kindergarten in the village.

Vanna is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to purchase mango and sapodilla from villagers to resell in the market, as well as filling the land around her house.

loans.use: To buy fruits to resell, and to fill the land around her house

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Safina N..  She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes/onions and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand the business.  Safina is 36 years old, married and her husband is a businessman .  She has seven children ranging from age 5 to 16 and her children go to school.  Each week, Safina makes approximately UGX 70,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business  Safina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in the business and the loan was paid back on time.  Safina is joined in her small group by Prossy Nabaka, Prossy Nakibuka, Irene Mukasa, and Angella Nassali.  Prossy Nabaka is currently in the clothing business and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to purchase more clothes.  Prossy Nakibuka is currently in the business of selling charcoal and food sales and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to buy more charcoal.  Irene Mukasa owns a video hall/ restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to buy more food.  Angella Nassali is currently in the hotel business and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to invest more in the business.

loans.use: To expand her retail food business

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: Fanta M. is 30 years old and married with two kids.  She lives on a farm and their livelihood depends on farming.  She grows cabbage, peppers, pigeon peas and rice.  With her previous loan, Fanta hired laborers and purchased seeds.  She also has other sources of income from micro-businesses in the village.  She sells essential items such as boxes of matches, salt, Maggie, etc., but her main income comes from farming.  She appreciates the previous loan from SMT that increased her production by 30%.  She is now requesting a loan of $525 for labor and for purchasing fertilizer.

loans.use: Fanta needs some farm inputs as well as help harvesting and tending to her crops.  She would benefit from a loan from Kiva so that she could purchase what she needs to have a fruitful crop and hire laborers to assist her in her success.

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
Nohemí Ramírez buys and sells shoes by catalog. She is married and her husband works as a laborer in a business. They have four children ages 10, 8, 5 and 2. She began her business five years ago, as her husband’s wages were low so she began the business to increase their household income. She obtained a loan to buy the catalogs and she began to sell to her friends.

Now she needs a loan for US$250, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise and complete her waiting orders. Let’s help Nohemí so that she may be able to continue to economically support her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Nohemí Ramírez se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatos por catalogo, es casada su esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa y tienen 4 hijos de 10, 8,5 y 2 años empezó el negocio hace cinco años, debido a que el sueldo de su esposo es bajo entonces ella empezó el negocio para aumentar los ingresos del hogar consiguió un préstamo para comprar los catálogos y empezó a vender entre sus amistades.

Ahora necesita un apoyo económico por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir pedidos pendientes. Ayudemos a Nohemí para que siga apoyando económicamente a su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Fatma's Mtegemee Mola Group

texts.en:
Fatma, age 35, is married with three children (ages 14, 9, and 4). Twenty years ago, Fatma began her business selling snacks, juice, shoes, and clothing from door-to-door. She is able to make a monthly profit of about $45.

Fatma hopes for a loan to purchase more stock to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members belong to group Mtegemee Mola. These members guarantee one another to pay back loans.

loans.use: To buy food items and clothing to sell door-to-door

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif was born in 1974. He lives in Khachmaz region. He is married and has two children. Seven years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of $975 to buy two calves.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Shoppers who pass Lubov’s neatly arranged retail space at the central city market in Nikopol will find an attractive selection of linen sheets,  towels, household supplies,  and everal choices in terry cloth robes for sale. She has had her own business for three years, and it has provided much needed income to support her family. Lubov currently has around $800 in inventory. 

Lubov is requesting a loan to purchase necessary inventory for the summer, which is a very profitable season for her business. Profits received from this loan will help her open additional vending locations and pay for a refrigerator she has just bought. We are happy for this opportunity to help Lubov improve her business and livelihood.

loans.use: To increase seasonal stock

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda S. was born in 1962 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2002. She is a hard-working and non-problem client. She trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures so she applies regularly to MicroInvest.

Mrs. Mavluda S. is engaged in commerce. She has a stall in the local bazaar where she sells garments. She is asking KIVA for a business development loan in the amount of 1600 STJ for 5 months to buy new imported seasonal goods and increase her turnover.

loans.use: buying new seasonal goods

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia T. âgée de 56 ans, est une veuve et mère de 8 enfants qui vit à Bougouni un village environnant de la ville de Ségou (préfecture de Ségou quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Initiée aux activités génératrices de revenus par sa mère, elle exerce le commerce de pagnes wax et de fancy (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’Ouest ) il y’a de cela 8 ans. 
Etant en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 5 ans, elle a bénéficié de 6 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et est à son deuxième individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 50 pièces de pagnes Wax et 10 pièces de pagnes Fancy auprès des commerçants grossistes de la capitale malienne Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et souvent à crédit de façon fixe au marché journalier du village et en ambulant (les pagnes mis dans une tasse) dans les quartiers de Bougouni les petits soirs à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes et de quelques d’hommes. 
Seule à mener l’activité d’achat et de vente de pagnes dans le village de Bougouni, donc sans concurrent elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et renforcer le fonds de commerce. Son ambition est de construire une maison pour ses orphelins.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rokia T. is a 56 years old widow and mother of eight (8) children. She lives in Bougouni, a village on the outskirts of the city of Segou (the prefecture of Sagou is the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She was taught by her mother in the ways of earning income through different business activities. Over the past eight (8) years she has been active in the business of selling "pagne" (decorative cloth). She has been associated with the Soro Yiriwaso microbank for five (5) years and has made six (6) group loans and is now on her second personal loan. All the loans have been repaid.

Mrs. T. plans to use this loan to buy 50 pieces of Wax brand pagne and 10 pieces of Fancy brand pagne from wholesalers in the Malian capital city of Bamako. She will resell these items for cash or credit at the daily village market and also through door-to-door selling (carrying her pagne, folded neatly in a head basket) during the evenings, in the Bougouni neighborhoods, to a clientele made up mostly of women and some men.

She is the leader in the buying and selling of pagne in the village of Bougouni. Without any competition she expects to earn a profit of 90,000 francs CFA which she will spend to meet the loan payments, provide for family expenses and support her business activities. Her ambition is to build a home for orphan children.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pagne (decorative cloth): Wax brand and Fancy brand

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia tiene 32 años y esta casada con el señor Reinerio Villasanti y tienen 4 hijos todos menores de edad.

Basilia anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de juegos de azar por la calle y hace 5 años que logro montar su despensa con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja constructor de obras.

Vive en casa propia que heredo de sus padres.

En el futuro desea comprar un vehiculo para transportar sus mercaderías y no seguir pagando fletes.
texts.en:
Ms. Basilia A. is 32 years of age, married to Mr. Reinerio Villasanti, and has 4 underage children.

Basilia used to sell games of chance on the street, but she managed to set up her own general store 5 years ago with the help of her husband, who works in construction.

She lives in her own home, which she inherited from her parents.

In the future, she would like to purchase a vehicle in order to transport her goods and not have to keep paying shipping costs.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods such as flour, cooking oil, rice, noodles, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma inicio hace 3 años con el negocio porque le ayudaba a vender zapatos por catalogo a una vecina así que decidió mejor venderlos por su cuenta porque la vecina le pagaba el 10 % de cada par y vendiendo ella el porcentaje de ganancia es del 50% por lo que era un mejor negocio, ya que ya había hecho clientes y hasta la actualidad le va bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir en mercancía y tener mejores ventas ya que desea poder tener un lugar en los mercados y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Norma started the business three years ago because her neighbor was benefiting from selling shoes by catalog so she decided to sell them on her own because her neighbor was paying her 10% for each pair she sold and selling them directly she would make 50% so that was a better business. She already had her clients and up until now things have gone well. She needs a loan for $400, which she will repay in six months, to invest in merchandise and increase sales as she wants to have a place to sell in the markets.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Fatou Ndiaye

texts.fr: Fatou Ndiaye S., 45 ans, mariée, 07 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de CESIRI depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce d’huile de palme, d’arachide, légumes et de tissu teinté qu’elle achète au Mali. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer au paiement de la facture d’électricité de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou Ndiaye S., age 45, is married and has seven children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group CESIRI for a year and a half. She wants to bolster her business in palm oil, peanuts, vegetables, and dyed cloth, which she buys in Mali. Her income enables her to help pay the family electricity bill. She is applying for a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil, peantus, and dyed fabrics

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị A. năm nay 32 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị đang làm nghề đan lưới tại gia đình. Bên cạnh đó gia đình chị còn có một cửa hàng nhỏ kinh doA. hàng tạp hoá. Với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị A. đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn, hai con của chị cũng được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ hơn.
Với mức vốn  10.000.000 mong muốn được vay trong vòng vốn tới, chị A. dự định sẽ sử dụng để đầu tư thêm vốn cho công việc kinh doA. của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi A. is 32 years old. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 1997. Today, she and her husband work from home making nets. They also have a small storefront selling general goods. With an income of 5,000,000 VND per month, her family's lifestyle continues to improve each day. And they can put money towards giving her children a more complete education. With the 10,000,000 VND she hopes to borrow in this loan cycle, Mrs.A. is planning to use it to invest more into the family's retail business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in family's retail business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Anna A. Nyengella from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has three children between the ages of 10 and 16. Anna has been in business as a food-seller since 2004. She buys crops from farmers at a low price and sells them in the city at higher price.She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Anna currently earns about $350 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase rice, maize and beans. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the goods.  Anna thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize and beans.

loans.name: Wache Waseme Group

texts.en:
Rukia has been a food seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $65. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food materials for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business in order to save money and pay the school fees of her children.

Rukia is 31 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages 17, 16, 11, and 8. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Fatma S., Sabah B., Mahaji Z., and Fatma R.. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more food materials for her business

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda A. sells building materials. He is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He is requesting a loan amount of  50,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: El grupo " Esmeraldas" esta representado por la señora Andrea y conformada por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Nicolasa y su hija Maribel  ellas cuentan con pequeños negocios propios e independientes una D. la otra. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a actividades comerciales como la venta D. refrescos, comida, empanadas, cosméticos, plásticos y a actividades como la confección D. prendas D. vestir a y a la construcción D. viviendas, este último desea emprender su negocio D. venta D. material escolar. Los socios(as) luchan día a día con la competencia pero tratan D. ganar su ingreso diario para poder llevar el pan D. cada día a su familia. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y para emprender nuevos negocios que les den mayor ganancia y una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias. La mayoría trabajo con  otras entidades financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital por lo que tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios, para otros miembros es su primer financiamiento, pero saben como trabajar y responder a sus obligaciones con responsabilidad y honestidad.
texts.en:
The "Esmeraldas" group is represented by Andrea and consists of 12 members, including family relations between Nicolasa and her daughter, Maribel. Each of them has their own small business and an independent income. The majority of the members work selling soft drinks, food, empanadas, cosmetics and plastics, or making clothes and building houses. Another member wants to start a business selling school supplies. The partners fight day to day against their competition, and try to earn an income to be able to bring their families their daily bread. The loan will be used to purchase inputs, materials and tools to improve their current incomes and start new businesses that will bring in a better income and thus a better quality of living for their families. The majority have worked with other financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital, and know how to work and respond to their obligations with responsibility and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa de José Guadalupe lña señora Juanita Rodriguez Pecina. La razón por la que el no aparece es por que no se encontraba ya que trabaja todo el día.
José Guadalupe Martínez C. con un anterior préstamo que le otorgaron, empezó la construcción de un cuarto el cual con los costos de material y pago de mano de obra no le alcanzo para poner el techo de su casa. Ahora el vuelve a recurrir con nosotros pidiendo el apoyo para poder terminar su proyecto y extenderse a la parte de enfrente de su vivienda.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the picture is Juanita Rodriguez Pecina, the wife of Jose Guadalupe Ina. The reason for which he is not in the picture is because he works all day. With a previous loan, Jose Guadalupe began the construction of a room. Due to the costs of labor and material, he did not have enough money to put a roof over his house. He requests further support to be able to finish his project and extend the front portion of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase housing materials

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria”, vive en la Mza. E – Lt. 5, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre 02 hijos, 01 que todavía depende de ella.

Con su crédito de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, inició su negocio con la venta de Anticuchos (carne a la parrilla) y nos cuenta que le va muy bien. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio vendiendo sus asados y juanes (comida típica de la región), ubicada en la vereda de su casa, donde vende a los moradores de la comunidad, amigos y vecinos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 que cancelará en 06 cuotas, lo invertirá ampliando e implementando su negocio, y comprará más mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, e insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos.
Ella mayormente toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente más independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y en los actos de su vida diaria.

Nos manifiesta su gran agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que quieren emprender su negocio y salir adelante solas.
texts.en:
Maritza belongs to the “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria community bank. She lives at Mza. E – Lt. 5, in the Tarapoto district, in the San Martín department. She is 36, in a common law marriage, has 2 children, 1 is still dependent upon her. With a loan of 300 PEN and her own initiative, she started her business selling Anticuchos (grilled meat). It is going well for her. She still has the same business selling grilled meat and juanes (typical regional dish), located on the path to her house. She sells to community members, friends, and neighbors. With this loan for 1,000 PEN, which she will repay in 6 payments, she will carry out and expand her business. She will buy tables, chairs, glasses, pots and supplies for daily food preparation. Generally, she makes the decisions about the earnings from her business. She now feels more independent and responsible about making her payments and in her daily life. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and for supporting other women who want to undertake their business and get ahead by themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food preparation.  To buy chairs and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Fatima Amjad Saeed Group

texts.en:
Fatima baji has resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Her husband's name is A. S. and he runs a CD center in the market. He has 3 years of experience in this business. He buys CDs from the famous market of the city of Lahore named “Hafiz center” and sells to his native city. Fatima baji operates a business sewing clothes. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy more CDs for her husband’s CD center.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Qamar baji, Rafiqan baji and Nusrat baji each want a loan to buy fruits & vegetables to sell. Hajran baji wants a loan to buy leather for her shoe making business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy CDs for CD center

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es: El Señor Oscar Martínez tiene 63 años de edad, vive en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa ama de casa, tiene cinco hijos dos ya casado y tres viven con ellos. Poco a poco han ido construyendo su casa, les falta todavía una parte de la casa lo cual Don oscar solicita un préstamo de vivienda. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic que es su sexto ciclo lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, perlines, bloque para construir la pared del frente de la casa y brindarle seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Martínez is 63 years old and lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur de Managua in the capital, Managua. He is married, his wife is a housewife, they have 5 children, two married and three living with them. Little by little they have been constructing their house and don Oscar is requesting a loan to be able to finish a part of the house. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, which is his sixth, he will be able to buy construction material such as cement, iron, purlins, and blocks in order to build the front wall of the house and offer security to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material to build a wall of a house.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es socio del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Javier es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Javier vende diferentes productos según la temporada y según la demanda, como gorras y guantes en épocas de frió, en julio sombreros y lentes, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria.
Javier necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gorras y bufandas.
Los sueños de Javier son comprar un terreno en el centro de la ciudad para construir una tienda.
texts.en:
Javier is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” community bank. He is 34, lives with his common-law wife and their 4 children. Javier sells different products depending on the season and the demand, for example he sells hats and gloves when it is cold and in July he sells sunglasses and summer hats as a street vendor. Javier needs a loan for 1,000 soles that he will invest in hats and scarves. Javier dreams of buying some land in the center of the city so he can build a store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: hats and scarves

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn R. is from the village of San Antonio, Ozamiz City,Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old and single. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling peanut butter. Jovelyn has just started this business.

In 2009, Jovelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients such as peanuts to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jovelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Dios Proveerá Group

texts.en:
Pictured here is the communal bank “Dios Proveerá” (God Will ProviD.), whose members have been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about four months.  The majority of the women live in the Manantay district in the city of Pucallpa.  Señora Loysi P. P. is 27 and is the president of “Dios Proveerá.”

“Dios Proveerá” has 12 members who are cheerful and seem to work well together.  The group is still small and its members are optimistic about their businesses.  They are requesting a loan of 8,200 Nuevos Soles in total, which each member plans to invest her portion in her business.  This will be the group’s second loan with Manuela Ramos.  The members of “Dios Proveerá” are taking seriously their commitment to make their loan payments.  The women of this communal bank dedicate themselves to a variety of businesses including selling basic grocery goods, clothing, shoes, sheets, plantains, jewelry, soda, juice and cooked food.  

The women are grateful to Manuela Ramos for the economic support provided by the organization.  They are also happy to have the educational sessions conducted by Manuela Ramos loan officers at their monthly meetings,  as these sessions will help them to further develop their businesses.

loans.use: Various goods for sale; raw materials for preparing juices and cooked foods

loans.name: Ithalie

texts.en:
Ithalie is a 32-year-old father of two who has run a small food kiosk for the last five years. He requested his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to purchase additional stock of foodstuff like flour, sugar and rice. He would like to continue to expand his business, one day diversifying into wholesale foodstuff. He hopes to provide for his family, send his children to school, and purchase a plot of land on which to build a home. He describes himself as friendly, social and hardworking.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. It recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa M. is a 60-year-old widow with two children, Amani and Tabu, who are ages 19 and 22.  Jumwa lives in Shanzu, Mombasa and has been running a grocery kiosk for the last six years. 

Jumwa learned about KADET through a client in Shanzu and she is glad to be accessing her first loan to finance her kiosk. With the loan she plans to purchase more vegetables and also refurbish her business premises. Her main customers are the residents of Shanzu town.

In the future Jumwa hopes to diversify by selling other foodstuffs in her store. She also hopes to establish a better and permanent retail store for her business.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Modesta Odili

texts.es: Modesta Odili M. P. tiene 35 años. Es una mujer responsable y trabajadora. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. Su negocio consiste en la venta de comida en el mercado, por lo que es aquí donde obtiene a sus clientes, ya que en su mayoría todos los clientes salen a la hora del almuerzo, es en este momento en donde Modesta empieza a servir los paltos de comida para que sus clientes tengan le mejor servicio. A pesar de los problemas que enfrento como es ser madre soltera y tiene que trabajar todo el día, porque tiene 1 hija y tiene que ser madre y padre a la misma vez para que a su hija no le falten los estudios y con la ayuda de Dios ha podido salir adelante. La inversión del  financiamiento será para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de la comida. Modesta tiene el sueño de ser la dueña de un restaurante y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Modesta Odili M. P. is 35 years old. She is a hardworking and responsible woman. She is engaged in the production and sale of food. She sells food in the market; it is there that she is able to find customers. The majority of her customers go out during the lunch hour; this is the time when Modesta begins to serve the meals for her customers in order that her customers have the best service. In spite of the problems that confront her as a single mother (having to work all day, having to be both mother and father at the same time for her daughter so that her daughter does not fall behind in her studies), with the help of God she has been able to continue to move ahead. This financing will be used to purchase raw materials for the production of food. Modesta has a dream of owning her own restaurant and improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B. is a 52-year-old general store owner from Dasmarinas, Cavite.  She is happily living with her husband, Carlos, 53, a driver, and their two children in a government relocation site for poor families.

Rebecca’s general store is yet a baby – she opened it only last year almost simultaneous with her joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. It is situated right in front of her house. Her store has grown steadily, accommodating the basic needs of her neighbors. Thanks to the loans provided to her by CCT, she can continuously stock up on grocery items and beverages. She also offers electronic load credits for mobile phones. She now earns a net of 17,000 PHP a month.

She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP as additional capital for her general store. She would buy more grocery items and soft drinks to sell at her store. This would be her third loan cycle with the cooperative.  She hopes to make her general store grow into a bigger grocery store to help even more her neighbors.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To re-stock on grocery items and soft drinks

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita C. is from the village of Makawa Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Jovita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.
