texts.en: Amy N., a 53-year-old married mother of six children, has been a member of the Village Bank "MBarry Gouytane" for eight years. She has long experience in raising sheep and has always paid back her loans on time. With this loan she will buy sheep which she will raise and sell on the market. This activity allows Amy to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza D. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bed sheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock sandals and shoes to sell. Tereza is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy three sewing machines.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock sandles and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en: Z. Rahmatullo is 58 years old and has a successful business selling flour, rice and mineral fertilizer at the local market of Shahrituz region. He sells an assortment of different items of good quality. Because Rahmatullo buys his goods wholesale, his prices are cheaper than those of his competitors. Thus he has many customers who even make a purchase of his products straight from his house. Today Rahmatullo has great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to take an individual loan. He has requested a loan of 13,000 Somoni to add to his working capital to allow him to purchase more inventory. Rahmatullo is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. IMON International believes his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase flour and rice to increase his stock of goods

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia T. is from the village of Brgy. Uno, Katipunan. She is 33 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Sonia owns and operates a retail store selling a variety of different products such as shampoo toothpaste etc. in the local community. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Sonia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and support her child's education.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel H. y su esposo el señor José Manuel Bernal tienen una linda familia de dos pequeños hijos, a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.
En este momento están pasando por un momento difícil tiene un familiar enfermo y quieren ayudarlo pero como no cuentan con el dinero. 
 Es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo y así poder ayudar a su familiar en estos momentos tan difíciles.
Planea pagar el préstamo con el sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo en una fabrica en el área de producción ya que si esposo el señor José Manuel se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía.
texts.en:
Ms. Isabel H. and her husband, Mr. José Manuel Bernal, have a beautiful family of two little children, for whom they wish to provide the best. At the moment, they are having a difficult time. They have a sick family member and they want to help him, but they don't have the money. It's because of this that they are asking for a loan, to be able to help their family in these difficult times. She plans to repay the loan with the earnings she obtains from her work in a factory in the area. Her husband, Mr. Jose Manuel, will be in charge of the their household expenses with the income he obtains from his work as a security guard for a company.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Bokk Jom/ndoffene1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité « BOKK JOM » est créé depuis 3 ans, il a 6 cycles d’existence. Il fait parti d’un des sous groupes qui composent le Banc Villageois de NDOFEENE1. Il est composé de 14 femmes toutes issues du même village et se sont organisées par affinité. Elles sont d’âges différents, entre 30 et 60 ans et sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 03 enfants. Leur activité principale est l’embouche bovine et/ou ovine, cette activité est très favorable dans la zone du fait de l’existence de beaucoup de marchés hebdomadaires. Ses marchés hebdomadaires drainent beaucoup de monde, ce qui contribue à l’accroissement de l’économie dans cette localité. Et comme activité secondaire elle font du petit commerce de céréales locales.

Madame Cécile Khémesse NGOME, en médaillon en bas et à l’extrême droite  de la photo, est âgée de 47ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants et tutrice de 03 autres qui lui sont confiés par des parents. Comme ses autres camarades de groupe, elle fait de l’embouche bovine et ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années. L’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son activité et son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, par exemple en payant la scolarité de ses enfants et en leur assurant une bonne couverture sanitaire.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "BOKK JOM" was created three years ago, having spanned six (loan) cycles.  It is part of one of the sub-groups that make up the Banc Villageois of NDOFEENE1.  The group is composed of fourteen women, all from the same village, who are organized by affinity.  They are of different ages, ranging from 30 to 60, and are all married mothers having at least three children each.  As their main work, the group members fatten cattle and/or sheep.  This is a very favorable business, where many weekly markets exist.  These weekly markets attract a lot of people.  It helps the economy of this town to grow.  As a secondary business, the group members do a little commerce in local grains. Ms. Cécile Khémesse NGOME, whose portrait appears at the bottom and to the far right in the photo, is 47 years old and the married mother of seven children.  And she is the guardian of three others entrusted to her by relatives.  Like her friends in the group, Cécile fattens cattle and sheep.  She has been operating this business for over ten years.  The goal of her loan is to bolster her business with the aim of helping to improve her family's living conditions by, for example, paying the schooling costs for her children and ensuring good health care for them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and further developing their revenue-generating businesses

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: D. M. Rose est née le 03 Avril 1952 et est mariée à De SOUZA Flavien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Rose vit depuis une quinzaine d’année au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rose vit avec ses enfants. Rose apporte une aide financière à son mari en l’aidant à répondre aux divers besoins de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité. Rose n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis huit ans environs, Rose vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs fermentée accompagnée de sauce et de poissons frits) de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Rose vend des produits divers (biscuits, bombons, savons, etc.). Rose achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Rose sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter la quantité de nourriture préparée pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Rose D. M., born April 3, 1952, is married to Flavien De Souza. They have two children, both educated. For about 15 years she has lived in the Gbégamey neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital, with her children. She helps her husband pay for the family's needs, thanks to her business income. She never went to school. For about eight years she has sold food door-to-door (corn mush and sauce, fried fish). She also sells other products such as cookies, candy and soap, which she buys at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center. She is asking for a second loan from ALIDé so as to grow her business by preparing more food for her customers.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cornmeal and condiments

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married and has a 12-year-old daughter. Natalya sells children's clothing in the central market in Novomoskovsk, owning several vending kiosks in the same marketplace. She launched her start-up four years ago and presently has over 65,000 Grivnyas invested in the business. Her income amounts to 20,000 Grivnyas a month.

Natalya is requesting a loan of 11,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for the upcoming fall season. In Ukraine, the school year begins in September and students are required to wear uniforms. Natalya wants to buy them in bulk for retail sale in August.

Natalya is an experienced vendor. She knows what a customer wants and tries to meet the demand. She is hoping to generate additional income and finish remodeling her new apartment which she bought only a year ago.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for the upcoming fall season

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida P. es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora desde hace 9 años cuenta con negocio de abarrotes llamado “Miscelánea Oyuky” en el que ofrece mejor calidad y bajo precio. La señora desea surtir el negocio de papelería para tener más variedad en su local y de esta manera pueda recibir más ganancias.
texts.en:
Adelaida P. is a hard-working and enterprising woman. For nine years she has had a grocery business called “Miscelánea Oyuky”. She sells good quality for a low price. She wishes to stock her business with stationery in order to have more variety in her place. This way she will be able to get more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G. is from the village of Dadda, Tuguegarao City. She is 43 years old. Teresita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Xiomara R. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Bibliotecaria en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene  ocho años de laborar para dicha Institución. En Ceprodel se le han otorgado siete créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ropa y zapatos escolares para sus hijos para las fiestas patrias que celebran en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara R. is from the town of El Sauce. She has been employed as a City Librarian for 8 years. Ceprodel has granted seven loans for personal expenses. This loan is requested to buy school clothes and shoes for her children for the national holidays that are celebrated in the country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For school expenses.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un señor de 39 años de edad, vive en San Carlos Morazán junto a su esposa y seis hijos quienes dependen económicamente de él, su trabajo es la albañilería realizándolo de lunes a sábado y de esta manera solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar.
Él está solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de cemento, arena, hierro para terminar su vivienda, y así tener una casa digna para el crecimiento de sus hijos, Este crédito le será de mucha ayuda pues el no cuenta con el dinero necesario para terminar de construir la casa.
El sueño de Pablo es poseer una casa segura y digna para vivir con la familia, para que en tiempo de lluvia no corran el riesgo de verse a afectados, mejorando así sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Pablo is 39 years old and lives in San Carlos Morazán together with his wife and six children, who depend on him economically. He is a bricklayer, and he works from Mondays to Saturdays to meet his family's basic needs. He is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, and steel to finish building a home, where he can raise his children with dignity. This loan will be a great help to him because he otherwise will not have sufficient money to finish his house. Pablo's dream is to have a safe and proper home for himself and his family so that they can be comfortable during the rainy season and improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Leziel

texts.en:
Leziel A. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Basak, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a rice-retailing business. Her husband Joenel, who is 43 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business. They have three children aged between 19 and 23.
Leziel joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leziel has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,000 PHP, thus raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock to sell so that she is able to continue to save up for the future expansion of her business.
Leziel A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Neli Francisco Paia

texts.pt:
Neli Francisco paia S. nasceu na província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 3 filhos de 11, 15 e 18 anos de idade, os dois mais novos vão a escola. Fez a 6ª classe não continuou devido a gravidez indesejada. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, possui um negócio próprio de venda de frangos ha mais de 4 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado conta com ajuda dos seus filhos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 20.000.00mt por cada lote de produção que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que já teve empréstimos nesta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos e raçoes para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro credito para fazer criação em grande escala.
texts.en:
Neli Francisco Paia S. was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is married and is the mother of three children, who are eleven, fifteen, and eighteen.  The two youngest are in school.  She finished sixth grade and didn't continue due to an unwanted pregnancy.  She lives in her own house with her children and doesn't financially support anyone outside of her family.

She never left the city of Maputo.  She has had her own business where she has sold chickens for more than four years.  She doesn't have any employees, but she has the help of her children.  She makes an income of 20,000 meticais for each lot that she produces, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some through a system known as Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system).

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who already had a loan with the institution.  This is her first loan in the amount of 16,000 meticais, which she will use to buy chicks and feed to increase the quantity of her stock.

She is confident that she will make her payments before their deadlines and will then ask for another loan to raise chickens on a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: José Alexis

texts.es: El Sr. José Alexis Z. M. él es productor dedicado a diversas actividades  agrícolas los rubros que siembra principalmente es el maíz, frijol, trigo  tiene veinte años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para preparar el terreno  y comprar los materiales  para la siembra,   los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
José Alexis Z. M. is a farmer.  He mainly grows corn, beans, and wheat.  He has been doing this for 20 years.  

He has had two loans with CEPRODEL.  He used each loan to prepare the land and buy materials for planting.  The CEPRODEL loans have been greatly beneficial to him because that is the way he has improved his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies like urea and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Celia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Celia del Socorro V. V., tiene la edad de 37 años, es casada y su esposo labora como Guarda de Seguridad, apoyándole a su familia con los gastos económicos  en que estos incurren , ellos tienen 3 hijos, y dos de ellos son mayores de edad que estudian la universidad y el menor  la secundaria, los padres de familia son agricultores, desde hace mas de 12 años, en donde han tenido problemas de sequia e infección de plagas, fue con el apoyo de su esposo que compro un pequeño terrero en el cual ahora están localizadas las siembras, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para un mantenimiento Fitosanitario optimo que favorezca la producción, aumente las ventas de las cosechas y mejore continuamente la economía de la familia, con el crédito compraran fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos que a futuro permitirán la incursión a nuevos mercados de vegetales que se consuman en masa. Esta inversión les admitirá suplir con el gasto económico que incurre la familia con sus hijos mayores en la Universidad.
texts.en:
Celia del Socorro V. V. is 37 years old, married, and her husband works as a security guard helping his family with the financial expenses that they incur. They have three children – two are adults and are university students and the youngest is in high school. The parents have been farmers for more than 12 years and have had problems with drought and pests. It was with the help of her husband that she bought a small piece of land where the crops are now located.

She is requesting a loan for her business to provide good plant health care that favors production, increases crop sales and continually improves the family finances. With the loan, they will purchase fertilizers, fungicides and plant supplies that will allow them to enter new vegetable markets in the future where the crops are widely consumed.

loans.use: Plant health care
